good evening po sir/Ma'am, isa po ako sa napili na bigyan nang CHED sa tertiary education subsidy. makakatanggap po kami nang 40k, sa pagkakaalam ko po november, 2018 pa po na release ang pera sa mga university gaya po nang pinapasukan ko. ang problema po e hanggang ngayun February 12, 2019 na ay hinde parin binibigay nang school namin ang sinasabing 40k, e rereklamo ko po lang sana kasi po sa lahat nang university dito sa surigao del sur. kami nalang po ang hinde nabigyan, sa kadahilanang tinatago po nang school namin yung pera nang government na dapat ebigay na sana sa mga scholar gaya ko, marami silang dahilan hanggang ngayun hinde parin nila binibigay ang pera sa mga scholar. ang name po nang school namin SURIGAO DEL SUR STATE UNIVERSITY LIANGA CAMPUS (SDSSU).. kung natanggap nyu po ang minsahe ko hinihiling ko lang po sana na wag epalabas ang pangalan ko, kasi po natatakot po ako na baka pag enitan po ako nang school namin at tatanggalin nila ako sa scholar at sa school.ginawa ko lang po etong mensahi na to kasi po hinde tama yung ginagawa nang school namin at naaawa narin ako sa mga kasamahan ko na pa ulit2 na po nilang pinapaasa sa mga dahilan nila.. thank you po and God bless...

Nakuha ko na sa akin nung June 18, 2021 pa, but the problem is kilangan ko pa syang I activate para sa PIN kunno.

Pano ko to nakuha.?

*nag fill up ng LANDBANK CASH CARD/PREPAID CARD ENROLLMENT FORM sa Unifast.ph then Finalize na Agad.

*nag hintay ng ilang months na mag Email ang LandBank para sa Transaction Purposes na sila ang mag bibigay ng Password and user name. Pag may email na si LandBank

*pumunta sa LandBank Branch na naka lagay sa Enrollment Form. Kasama ang Printed LANDBANK CASH CARD/PREPAID CARD ENROLLMENT FORM na Finalize at UPDATED SCHOOL ID.

*then pag nasa Landbank ka na ibibigay mo lang ang Printed LANDBANK CASH CARD/PREPAID CARD ENROLLMENT FORM at UPDATED SCHOOL ID.

*Upo ka lang saglit ibibigay na nila yong MASTERCARD ng walang bayad.

*then labas ka na ng LandBank.

Keep Praying lang mga guys, dadating din yan 😊 . GodBless All 😇

Unag Una nais ko pong magpasalamat Sa mga bumubuo Ng CHEDPinaskolar(TES) Dahil Sa Kanila may dahilan ako para maipagpatuloy ang aking pag aaral, Ng walang binabayaran Sa school at may natatanggap pa.

Fresh Grantees year 2019-2020

1st Semester and 2nd Semester: napaayus ko po ang bubong mg aming bahay sapagkat butas butas at tumutulo kapag umuulan, SA tulong Ng TES naka bili ako Ng mga materyales (Semento, sem, etc) at masasabi ko po na safe na ang aming bahay kapag umuulan, nakabili Rin po ako Ng TV sa amin sapagkat naaawa ako SA mga kapatid ko na maliliit na Kung saan saan nalang nakikinuod, bumili Rin ako Ng isang sakung bigas at mga groceries na kailangan Ng pamilya ko at Yung iba Pina savings ko SA mama ko sapagkat Kung kakailanganin ko man ang pera para Sa school may mabubunot ako at Hindi na mamumbrublema, dahil SA ngayun po may Cp Naman ako at access Ng WiFi na nagagamit para SA online class. At masasabi ko talaga I'm very grateful for having this kind of opportunity na mabigyan Ng scholarship.

PUBLIC ADVISORY
June 29, 2021

Now that we are approaching Academic Year 2021-2022, the Commission on Higher Education and UniFAST get a multitude of inquiries on how to apply for the Tertiary Education Subsidy.

We would like to inform the public and our stakeholders that TES is a grant-in-aid program of the government that is being implemented by CHED and UniFAST through the higher education institutions (HEIs).

We hereby advise to exercise self-restraint and caution against individuals or groups claiming to be representatives of UniFAST. These entities will try to make an offer to facilitate the application of an interested student or promise to provide a guaranteed TES slot. Do not engage in any transaction requiring you to pay a certain amount because the application for TES is FREE.

Please be reminded that the TES follows a prioritization scheme and new applicants undergo the validation and verification process to qualify as a TES grantee. All state universities and colleges (SUCs), CHED-recognized local universities and colleges (LUCs), and private higher education institutions with an existing memorandum of agreement with the Commission and UniFAST are the only ones eligible to implement TES.

The call for TES application will open once the first semester of AY 2021-2022 starts. This will be announced on CHED and UniFAST websites at https://ched.gov.ph/ and http://unifast.gov.ph/ with the following social media accounts @PhCHED.gov, @DeVeraPopoy, @unifastofficial.

For any fraudulent activity, you may report it to the Commission and its Regional Offices or to the UniFAST Secretariat so we can respond appropriately. Email us at unifastsecretariat@ched.gov.ph or askunifast@ched.gov.ph and call (+63) 928 551-1317 or (+63) 998 985 2955.

Thank you.

From: PARTIDO STATE UNIVERSITY ( SAN JOSE CAMPUS)

Mahina sa Math etong dating CHED-UNIFAST staff. At hindi naiintindihan ang budget process.

Oo tumaas ang budget ng CHED mula 2018 dahil napasa ang Free Higher Ed law. Pero ang binibigay na budget kada taon ay para sa fiscal year (January-December) pero ang pag disburse ng pondo ay ayon sa academic year (June-May o August-July depende sa academic calendar na gamit ng HEIs).

Kaya imposible na magastos ang buong pondo ng Free Higher Ed sa December 31 dahil 1st sem palang ang natatapos.

At hindi pwedeng maibigay ang 2nd semester TES by December dahil ka susubmit palang ng claims ng HEI (sa gumagamit ng june-may academic calendar) o hindi pa nagsisimula ang 2nd semester (kung ang academic calendar ay August-July).

Last year (2020) maraming SUC nagsimula ng 1st sem sa October/November at natapos January. Pano ibibigay sa December ang TES e hindi pa nga enrolled sa 2nd sem ang estudyante?

At ni re-release lang ng DBM ang pondo pag kumpleto ng listahan ng TES beneficiaries.

Imbes na maniwala kayo sa propaganda na ito, basahin niyo ang sabi ng DBM sa paggamit ng pondo ng CHED.

PERKS OF BEING A WORKING STUDENT:
Makaulit ng gusto ka mag study, pero nakatulog kas kakapoy pag mata nimu adlaw na diay. Daghan kaayo kag activities buluhaton pero imung lawas gusto'g relax. Inom nag coffee na without sugar pampamata kaso katugon jud ko. Daghan kag mga buluhaton tapos wa kay magamit na gadgets kay lisud sa cp mag edit 😔
SWERTE ka kung naa ra ka dinha sa inyung balay nagahulat ug announcement sa exam and quizzes. SWERTE ka kung naay parents ga bayad sa imuhang tuition. SWERTE ka kung di ka ga apas pirmes oras tungod sa work and studies. SWERTE ka kung kumpleto kag gamit and stuffs for online class. SWERTE ka kung kumpleto kag family Kay ako broken fam jud since infant, namatay nalang akong amahan wa nako Makita. Maong pagtarung ug skwela tungod dili tanan nagahinan ug opportunity sa pag swkela, e treasure na kay para na sa maayo nimu nga kaugmaon. Ug SWERTE gihapon ming mga working student tungod kay gihatagan mi sa Ginoo ug sakto na huna-huna ug panglawas arun ma handle tanan pressure ug struggles. Study hard, aim high ug ampo always Kay God 🥰❤️

Good Afternoon Po Mam/Sir From Northern Samar Colleges.Regarding Po Sa Schoolar Na TDP Dito sa School Namin .Nawala Po Ako Sa Lista🥺 matagal napo akong scholar since 2018 pa Po ..Ngayon lang Po Ako Hindi na Nasali sa Lista ..Bakit Po Ganun😢 Wala Naman pong Problema sa Mga grades ko at Pati narin sa Mga Requirements na Pinapasa sa school updated Po Ako lahat .pero Bakit Po wala Ako Sa Lista 😆 Huminge narin Po Ako Ng tulong sa School Namin Pero Ganun din Po Ang sagot sakin Wala parin daw Po Update . FOR EVERYONE ENCOUNTERING THE SAME PROBLEM AS THE PHOTO BELOW, here is the feedback from UniFAST IT personnel: pag ganito po maam, advise po natin yung grantee na i minimize yung image files (2x2 photo, Front ID, Back ID) na ia upload para mag success yung uploading ng image sa porta;. Pwede po sila gumamit ng third party software na free to download like "FILEminimizer Pictures". then yung output po nitong software ang i upload sa portal. Sample software lang po ito maam na pwede gamitin nung grantee, pwede naman po sila gumamit ng ibang software as long as nakakapag minimize ng image file.

For this guys you can use online sites such as www.tinypng.com , www.iloveimg.com , or other sites i search nyo lang sa goole so that you can minimize the file size of your images.

FOR THOSE ENCOUNTERING THE SAME ISSUE AS THE PHOTO BELOW, please do the ff: directly contact LBP customer service for issues with the Mastercard Cardholder's Portal ng LBP:
NCR: (+632) 8 405 7000
Outside NCR: 1 800 10 405 7000

Voters' Youth Education Forum 2022 has concluded.

An activity intended to inform and educate the voters, particularly the youth, for them to be able to choose rightfully and conscientiously the local leaders they want to be stewards of progress and development in the City of Zamboanga.

This forum is a collaborative effort of the three SUCs in Zamboanga City, Western Mindanao State University (WMSU), Zamboanga Peninsula Polytechnic State University (ZPPSU), and Zamboanga State College of Marine Science and Technology (ZSCMST) through the initiative of the Commission on Higher Education-Regional Office IX (CHED ROIX). Such activity has also been participated by other partners such as Commission on Election (COMELEC), Philippine Information Agency (PIA), and Kapisanan ng mga Brodkaster ng Pilipinas (KBP).

Photo Credits to WMSU PAO.

Nag email na po ako sa CHED caraga and Unifast several times na po, nya ni adto na pd ko school namo sa ako concern pero wala po silay concrete or clear na answer po sa ako concern. Graduated na po ako last June 30,2022, and sa 4 years ko po as a TDP-TES grantee ka isa ra po ako naka received sa ako scholar kadtong 2nd year nako which is for 1st year pa nga cash assistance po. Niya sa sige po nko email sa CHED nangayo sila sa akong grades and naa paman daw ko ma'am/sir. Pero sa ako 2nd year and 3rd year nga cash assistance wala jd koy nadawat. Then kinia ang reply po sa ako sa email

"Good day! We would like to inform you that since na transfer na sa UniFAST ang mga TDP grantees last 2020, we have checked the portal and you have been validated naman po so you are also paid na po. For AY 2021-2022, ongoing pa ang validation so wala pa na process ang payments. If once lang po kayo na paid sa school, kindly coordinate with your scholarship coordinator po sa school because disbursed funds are with the school na po."

Pero pag adto po nko sa school namo sa scholarship coordinator ni ingon siyag wala pd daw siya kabalo sa akoa case kay kun unsa ra pd daw an e pasa sa ila na mga list sa names mao ra pd daw to ila ma release san. Pero ingon sa email "disbursed funds" so naka released na po sa ako pero wala jd koy nadawat. Hoping po matabangan po ko diria kay naglibog na po ko asa ko muduol. Pero this School year pag lantaw sa Scholarship coordinator po sa school namo naa man lagi ako name. Pero wala palang nag release pa. Mao ra pd na ako katingayan kay naa ko karon probably naa sad ko adtong sa 2nd year and 3rd year nako pero asa man? Tana po matabangan ako. Salamat po daan ma'am/sir sa tabang. I am a TES Grantee from Bohol Island State University - Main Campus. Obviously, I am beyond grateful to CHED and UniFAST for having these programs which helps a lot of students who are willing to pursue their education but don't have financial means. I for myself, as a TES grantee, it helps me greatly most especially on the onset of the pandemic which shifted the modality of learning from Traditional Face-to-Face Class to Online Class. It also helped me fund our Agricultural Rice Farming from from planting up to harvesting. Therefore, I stand firm with the vision and mission of these platform and I will forever be thankful to all of you behind these effective educational programs.

Pwede naman mag working student ang mga kabataan o di kaya mag online job kahit part time para may pantustos sa kanilang pag-aaral. Hindi ibig sabihin wala na pampaaral sa iyo eh magiging tambay ka na. Kung gusto, may paraan.

Pwede naman magrequest ng CHED ng SS number as an additional requirement sapagkat alam naman nila kung sino sa mga student grantee ang may trabaho na o wala. Kapag may pumapasok ng SS remittance mula sa kanilang local employers, sasabihan naman ang company na pwedeng ibawas thru salary deduction tapos sila na ang direktang magbayad nito sa CHED. Or pwede na ipadaan thru SSS educational loan program. Required din naman iyang SSS membership kapag OFWs, pwedeng ipadaan thru OWWA or private recruitment agencies. Hindi solusyon sa non-collection ang alisin ang study now, pay later sapagkat ang kawawa rito ay ang mga totoong mahihirap at pamilyang kapos sa pamumuhay.

A few weeks ago I messaged Bukidnon State University Main Campus through their Facebook page regarding my undisbursed StuFaPs grant for the 3rd year 2nd semester and both semesters for 4th year. I was just asking for updates since some of my classmates/batch mates and friends have already claimed theirs (TES, Tulong-Dunong) and behold, it's been almost 2 years from now with no clear justification as to the status of my grant. The school responded and they made sure that my query/concern will be endorsed to the Scholarship Satellite In-charge the soonest since she was not around.

As usual, i patiently waited for my concern to be addressed for that's the least i can do but not until today. I was messaged by one of our instructors to call CHED to clarify the status of my grant and without hesitation, I responded quickly with high hopes. But then they explained to me that my name was no longer included in the new system after they migrated their data from the old one. The reason was the school where I was enrolled in did not submit a billing, and they said that i could no longer get my grant and there's nothing they could do as much as they want to help, unless they have been notified of my status much earlier.

I was really frustrated after hearing all the explanation. As far as I remember, I worked hard during the last three semesters of my undergraduate studies to comply with the GPA required for StuFaPs. As a graduate student, it is so frustrating to think that I still have 3 semesters of undisbursed grants with no clue if it's still there. I would have understood if the negligence was mine, that I did not take full responsibility for my academic obligations, but it's not the case, and I wouldn't have overreacted this much. My scholarship means a lot to me, it was a previlege that not everyone has a chance to have. As a self supporting student before, it was a backbone that aided and helped survive my college.

If I did not ask for updates from the school, no action will be given. If I did not ask, nothing will happen. Imagine ako pa ang nakig storya directly sa CHED maskin wla sa ako ang negligence, with no official statement or prior explanation from Bukidnon State University Main and Libona Satellite Campus. Absurd.

Please lang, I demand not just a clear justification of my case, but a full accountability as well. Gamay man to nga kantidad para sa inyo, dako na to ug tabang para sa ako especially to compensate all the financial burdens I paid before, during and after graduation.

In my opinion naman kasi di na kailangan Yung k12 patagal Lang yan Makatapospag aral ng studyante nakipagsabayan Lang sa ibang bansa Kaya yan na implement Di naman handainstead Dapat mastery Nalang yung pinatupad yung gusto pumunta sa ibang bansa yung Dapat may k12 pag inalisnaman ang k12 maapektuhan ang Mga guro ng k12 mawalan Sila ng work. Dapat di Nalang nila dinagdagan ng years para Makatapos ng high school total wala naman budget ang tulong ng gobyerno pag college useless rin yung k12 na pinatupad Nila di rin lahat Makatapos ng pag aral ang studyante.Instead k12 pinatupad Dapat subject Nalang yung dinagdaganNila tapos adjust Nalang sa schedule sa weekdays or Pwede naman Siguro advance learning lesson Nalang yung pinatupad ng gobyerno di yung k12.

Imbes yung budget ng k12 noon pinagawa Nalang Sana ng Mga pandagdag na paaralan, pampasweldo ng Mga teachers, paghire ng marami teachers, panggastos ng complete materials ng skwelahan para magamit ng studyante di Sana Kinulang ng budget ang gobyerno.

"I was born into a simple family. My father is a farmer and my mother is a housekeeper. When my sister continued her college education, I had to stop studying because of financial problems. I wanted to finish school so I packed my things, left home, and worked as a pancit vendor, a factory worker, a housekeeper, and a service crew. It was hard to take my classes during the day and work in the evening every day.

Luckily, I was selected to be one of the TES grantees. They gave me a chance to finish my studies and achieve my dream to help my family. Thank you, CHED-UniFAST!"

Remilyn Barbosa
Isabela State University
Bachelor of Science in Public Administration

Magandang umaga po sa lahat.

Ako po si Sarah jean A. Loyola, from Dr. Emilio B. Espinosa Sr. Memorial State College of Agriculture and Technology, taking up Bachelor of Elementary Education, Major in General Education.

Maraming maraming Salamat po sa lahat ng bumubuo ng TES Grantees, dahil isa po ako sa napabilang ng programa ninyo pong ito.

Maraming Salamat po sa Tulong ninyo. Napakalaking tulong po sakin bilang estudyante na napabilang po ako sa TES grantees upang pangdagdag sa pangtustos/gastusin ko sa pag-aaral.

First Semister of 2019-2020

Mga Nagastos ko po;

Pamasahe namin ng kapatid ko papuntang Munisipyo upang kunin iyong Module naming dalawa, Load ko para sa online class namin, at binibigyan ko po ng Load ang kapatid ko na mag Second year naman ngayong susunod na pasukan po sa pinapasukan ko (DEBESMSCAT).
Binili ko po ng Ream na mga Bondpapaper long and Short po.
Binili ko po ng Mga Pangdikit/paste katulad Double sided Tape po, Manila paper ng kapatid ko at Pentelpen, at saka po Colored Paper naming dalawa.
Binili ko din po ng Bigas namin, dahil wala pong trabaho ang Papa ko, dahil sa sinapit niya noong Bagyong Tisoy, nahulugan po kasi si Papa ng isang Piling Buko sa Benti at nabali po ito, kaya po ibinili ko nalang iyong ibang pera sa Bigas po para sa pang-araw araw namin na pagkain, hindi po kasi sapat ang perang pinapadala sa amin ng kuya ko, lalo na po na napakarami namin Magkakapatid, at dalawa pa po kaming College students kaya naman po napakalaking Tulong po ang TES po, dahil nakatulong sa aming gastusin sa pang araw-araw.

Second Semister 2019-2020

Mga nagastos ko po.
Binili ko po ng Cellphone dahil ang luma ko pong cellphone ay full storage hindi na po kasi malagyan ng ibang apps kaya po bumili nalang po akong cellphone para po sa pang online class ko po.
Binili ko po ng Practice teaching book, bagong Uniform.
At iyong ibang pera po ginamit ko sa aking Practice Teaching sa pang araw-araw na gastusin ko po dahil malayo ang paaralang Pinag Pt

Since A.Y. 2019-2020 up to incoming academic year, I've been benefiting the UNIFAST Tertiary Education Subsidy(TES). It's a big help especially for students experiencing financial incapability to sustain higher education like my case. Thank you so much and may God bless the people behind the program. More power!!!

"My mother doesn't have a job and my dad passed away three years ago so no one supports my education except my sister. I always try to be on the dean's list to help my sister financially.

The TES is such a great privilege and it gives us a chance to finish our studies. No words can explain how grateful I am. UNIFAST makes our dream to graduate come true and to have a good profession in the future. I can assure you that we use the TES grant the right way and it truly helps us in so many ways. My sister use half of the money to build a small business so we can have a good start. I want to say thank you and more blessings to the people behind this program. You are heroes to so many students!"

Jamaica Nikka Ona
Manuel S. Enverga University Foundation Candelaria Inc.

I am a working student in my entire college years. Balancing work life and studies can be quite hard. Working while studying is not all doom and gloom. It is actually one of the most rewarding methods of studying. Yes it comes with challenges. Working while studying shouldn't be a huge challenge. It offers a lot of benefits such as saving time and money as well as being able to keep your social life. If you plan a head, manage your time, your life will be a breeze. Never stop your education just because you're financially incapable, there are a lot of ways to survive. Walay na buhi anang olaw2. I'll tell you, it felt so nice to finally hold my bachelor's degree 🥺

To those people who said i can do it even if I'm not sure i could, you know who you are, a big thank you to all of you 😘.

"Ako'y working student simula noong Grade 6 pa lamang. Namulat sa mga mabibigat na trabaho noong pumanaw ang aking ina dahil hindi kaya ng aking ama na paaralin kaming pitong magkakapatid. Wala sa isip ko ang salitang "suko" at "pagod" dahil sa bawat sikat ng araw, nakasalalay sa aking sariling sikap ang aking kinabukasan.

Nang ako'y mag-kolehiyo, nasuklian ang hirap ng isang hindi inaasahang biyaya na galing sa CHED - ang Tertiary Education Subsidy. Hindi ako makapaniwala dahil maraming binago sa buhay ko ang TES. Tunay na walang imposible kung may tiyaga at pagpupursigi."

Jocerelle Matas

Way back when I was in my college years 2018-2019 I applied for this scholarship pra makatulong sakin for financial support kase mahirap lang ako.. Naalala ko pa nung first release ng lists of scholars pagkita ko wla doon yung name ko ang sakit at nakakalungkot tlaga.. Na hopeless mn ako noon pero di ako sumuko o huminto sa pag-aaral ko. Last year ko nilang nun sa college kaya itinatak ko nilang sa isipan ko baka di tlaga ako swerte dyan sa mga scholarship na yan.. Inisip ko nilang paano ako makaka graduate. Mahirap mn ang proseso natutunan kong di sumuko.. Hanggang sa narating ko din yung time na nag pictorial na kmi at YES gagraduate na din ako! Nagbunga din yung SACRIFICES and HARDWORK ko Thanks to God! 😇

After graduation wala na sa isip ko itong scholarship na to. Let's make it short, I focused on moving on and looking forward for the next step of my dreams. It takes few months na nag review ako in preparation for my board exam. Sinamahan ko din ng prayers and Faith. Month of September when I took LET exam.. Pagdating ng December napa say ako ng Thanks God! You answered my prayers 😇🙏 The best Gift I've received.☺ Year 2020 ng Oath-taking and finally I'm now officially LPT.. ❤❤❤

Late man dumating sakin ang TES , kahit inisip ko na impossible kase 2 years ago na yun but still God is Good..🙏 God is the best! His timing and plans unexpected.

"PANGARAP KUNG NAHIMLAY AY MULING NABUHAY"

Bilang isang mag-aaral ako ay may pangarap din sa buhay na gustong makamit pero dahil namulat ako sa mundong aking kinalalakihan na napakahirap mamuhay sa mundong pagsasaka lamang ang pinagkukunan ng inyong hanap buhay.😆Tapos wala kapang Ama noon dahil nasa kulungan po😢😭pero dahil may determination kang makapagtapos ng pag-aaral kahit ang hirap na ng buhay na parang ayaw mo nang lumaban pero kinaya mo dahil gusto mong maahon sa hirap ang iyong mga magulang balang araw.Kaya nagdesisyon akong pumasok bilang working student para makapagpatuloy kahit wala na akong oras at panahon halos sa aking pamilya at sarili dahil kailangan kung magdouble time sapagkat may kapatid akong may kapansanan na kailangan kung bigyan ng sustento araw-araw😢😆dahil sa sitwasyon namin na wala kaming ama na bumo-buhay namin😆 Tapos malalaman mo pa na nagkakasakit magulang mo😆Nang mga panahong iyon ay halos wala akong kain-kain makapasok lamang ng paaralan at ang masakit pa noon ay may family problem kami sa bahay na halos ikasawi ng buhay ng aking nakatatandang kapatid😆😭At buti na lamang ay naagapan ito sa tulong ng aming mga kapitbahay.😊 🙏❤Ang hirap-hirap ng buhay kapag wala kang Ama at wala kayong financial para sustentuhan ang iyong pag-aaral lalo na ang buhay ng inyong pamilya.😆😭😢
Kaya nang sinabihan ako ng aking kaibigan na mayroong TES/UNIFAST SCHOLARSHIP ay hindi ako nagdalawang isip na mag.apply nang sa ganon ay makapasok ako bilang isang TES GRANTEE. 😘Noong nalaman ko na ako ay isa sa mga TES GRANTEE ay labis akong natuwa sapagkat ako ay matutulungan ng programmang ito. ❤🙏😇Kaya lubos akong nagpapasalamat sa Programma ng TES/UNIFAST at ako ay inyong natulungan hindi lamang ang aking pag-aaral kundi pati narin ang aking kapatid na may kapansanan❤😊¡Dahil nakabili po ako ng Laptop at nabilhan ko po ng vitamins ang akong kapatid na may kapansanan.🙏😇❤Sana po'y muli niyo akong matulungan sa pagkakataong ito dahil gusto ko pong maipagamot ang aking kapatid na may KAPANSANAN😆😢🙏❤
GOD BLESS YOU PO. MORE POWER🙏😇

IZIEL SUMALINOG PACAYDE
Bachelor of Secondary Major in Filipino
3rd yr. Student
Franciscan College of the Immaculate Conception
Brgy. Maypatag Baybay City, Leyte

Inang kinagisnan, bakit pinabagsak?
Mga anak ba'y 'di kuntento sa halad?
Awitin ng langit, ngayon ay pag-iyak,
Kasabay ng himig ng orkestrang huwad,
Sino pa'ng masayang sasabay sa indak,
Kung tono naman ay pawang sawim-palad?
Magagandang dulot niya'y nawawala,
Ni bakas ay hindi masisilayan pa,
Bakit kailangan may 'sang magparaya,
Upang makamtan ang modernong ligaya?
Ganito na nga ba; kanyang kapalaran,
Ang gahàsain si Inang Kalikasan?
Ang pagpiyestahan iring kanyang laman?
Daráng sa apoy at ginawang pulutan!
Tinapyas ang gubat ng talim ng gulok,
Kinalbo ang párang pati mga bundok,
Tinapon; retaso na bulok na bulok,
Naiwang luhaan sa pagkadayukdok.
Sinakmal ng ngipi't kamandag ng pangil,
Dugo'y bumalisbis sa pagkakakitil,
Inang Kalikasa'y ramdam ang hilahil,
Mula sa lipunang 'balat-kayong anghel.

HINDI HADLANG ANG KAHIRAPAN SA TAONG MAY PANGARAP

Bata palang ako pangarap ko nang makatapos ng pag-aaral.ngunit sa tulad kung lumaki sa hirap parang imposible na makatapos ako sa pag-aaral lalo pat ulilang lubos na ako sa magulang.sa murang edad natutu na akong magtrabaho para matugunan ko Ang aking mga pangangailan.hanggang isang Araw naisipan Kong mag-aral ulit.alam Kong mahihirapan ako unang una panggastos sa aking pag-aaral,may naitabi man akong kunting pera alam ko pong diyon magkakasya.hanggang sa napasali ako sa CHED scholarship.unang una Hindi ko lubos maisip na masasali ako sa ganitong oppurtunidad.pakiramdam napakaswerte ko dahil una sa lahat sa dami naming mag-aaral akoy napabilang sa mga TES grantees.Dahil sa CHEDUnifast nabago niyo Buhay ko.dahil sa Inyo nakabili ako ng loptop at cellphone na magagamit ko sa pag-aaral.kong dati nanghihingi lang ako ng baon ngayon hindi na.napakaswerte ko dahil Hindi lang pag-aaral ko ang natulungan niyo kundi pati mga pamangkin ko na nagsisipag-aral ngayon.napakaswerte ko dahil nakakaipon na ako dahil sa tulong niyo.maraming maraming salamat CHEDUnifast sa lahat ng tulong na pinagkaloob niyo sa akin.Hindi lang sa akin kundi pati narin sa ibang mag-aaral na natulungan niyo.nasa ika-apat na taon na ako sa taung ito.isang taon na Lang po matatapos ko na Ang kursong kinuha ko.maraming maraming salamat CHEDUniFast at sa ating panginoon na laging nakaagapay sa amin.thank you ma'am Babie Jaromay Deguia sa walang sawang suporta na pinagkakaloob mo sa aming mga TES grantees.

Good Day everyone!
I am Jeanly C. Ortiz, taking up Bachelor of Secondary education major in English. And fortunately a third year student in this school year.
I just want to extend my heartfelt gratitude to God, to CHED PINASkolar Region V and to my School Liceo de Masbate Registrar's Office-Liceo de Masbate for making our dreams realistic.
Being a Unifast Grantee, bring me hope to finish my study in college. Wherein before I started taking college a big question comes to my mind "could I be able to finish my study?". But still I pursue my education beside of our poverty because I do believe that "poverty is not a hindrance in education" esp. to those person willing to attain their life goals. In my situation, as a fatherless it is not easy especially that my Mother doesn't have a stable job. I come to the point that I decided to stop my study to find work because my tuition fees sem by sem are increasing. Which is a very big burden to me financially and emotionally. But #Unifast changes everything, it brings good hope to me and to my future. It makes things possible out of impossible. At first, I thought it was just a dream but then the time that I received my very first TES grants, then I realized it is real.

Again, Maraming Salamat sa Lahat!

#CHEDPINASkolar
#Unifast
#DiosMabalos.

JUST SO YOU KNOW

Under section 261 (v) and (w) of Batas Pambansa No. 881, COMELEC Resolution No. 10747, Government Procurement Policy Board Resolution No. 20-2021 and GPPB Circular No. 03-2021, prohibits the release, disbursement or expenditure of public funds during forty-five days before a regular election and thirty days before a special election.

The prohibition period against infrastructure, social and housing-related projects is from March 25, 2022 to May 8, 2022.

- Infrastructure projects include the construction, improvement, rehabilitation, demolition, repair, and maintenance of information and technology physical facilities and infrastructure and other ICT-related civil works.
- Social projects refer to projects undertaken by the Department of Social Welfare and Development and any other office in any other department of the government performing functions similar to the said department. By lay definition, Social Project means a project related with the public services that the government provides to the public free of charge or at nominal charge and include education (scholarships and study grants), health, potable water, and road projects.
- Procurement entities are allowed to proceed with the commencement and completion of procurement during the election period but are prohibited from issuing a Notice of Award for procurement projects covered by the prohibition.

Unexpected and Proud to be part of this scholarship.

Subrang nagpapasalamat ako sa Ched/unifast at sa mga bumubuo nito dahil isa ako sa mapalad na munting mag aaral na nagpupursigi at na ngangarap para sa kinabukas ko at sa pamilya ko.

Sa simula palang talaga parang nagdadalawang isip na ako kung mag aaral ba ako sa koliheyo o hindi?
Kaya ko ba o kaya ba ito tustusan ng magulang ko?
Piro sa salaysay ng aking mga magulang nakikita kung kakayanin nila , dapat daw ako makapag tapos kasi ako ang panganay na tutulong na makapag tapos din ang aking mga kapatid sa hinaharap at aahon sa kahirapan na nararanasan namin ngayon.
Kaya nagsikap ako na makapag aral sa koliheyo.
Nang ng nagsisimula na ang klase subrang hirap hindi ako makasabay sa klase ko dahil sa hirap ng internet connection sa bahay nmin at sa kasamaang palad wala din akong maayos na telephone na nagagamit sa online class.
Subrang hirap hanggang naisip ko nilang na huminto muna sa pag aaral piro naisip ko din paano ang pangarap ko? Paano ang mga pinaghirapan ng mga magulang ko? Paano ang mga kapatid ko? Kaya pinagpatuloy ko pa din ang pag aaral ko.

At sa awa ng DIYOS isang araw napabalita sa akin na Tes Grantee ako subrang saya ko dahil malaking tulong ito sakin at sa pamilya ko. Nang nakuha ko ang unang blessing ko bumili agad ako ng cellphone na gagamiton ko sa pag aaral ko at bumili din ako ng mga kakailanganin ng pamilya ko pang araw araw .

Kaya maraming maraming salamat CHED/UNIFAST sa tulong niyo naway marami pa ang inyong matulungan na kagaya ko na mahirap at nangangarap.

Mahirap maging mahirap piro mas mahirap kung mananatili tayong mahirap kaya kong may nakikita tayong kunting pag asa na makapag aral sa koliheyo ipagpatuloy natin ito . Wag mawalan ng pag asa manalig lang sa DIYOS dahil sa kanya'y walang impossible .

- Mary Rose Perol
- Bachelor of Science in Fisheries Industry
- Eastern Visayas State University Carigara Campus

"Ako ang breadwinner ng aming pamilya. Nawalan ng trabaho ang ama ko na OFW dahil sa pandemya. Pinagsasabay ko ngayon ang aking pag-aaral at trabaho bilang barangay health worker.

Napakalaking tulong ng TES dahil kung hindi dahil dito, hindi ako makakapagpatuloy sa kolehiyo. Simula noong nagka-TES hindi ko na intindihin ang tuition at nakabili rin ako ng laptop gamit sa online class. Nagkaroon pa ng puhunan para sa aking online selling at sari-sari store. Malaking bahagi ang TES sa aking buhay at taos-puso akong nagpapasalamat sa CHED-UniFAST. Hindi ko makakamtan ang aking pangarap na makapag-aral kung hindi dahil sa inyo."

"Being one of the chosen grantees of TES was one of the most wonderful blessings I received during my college days. I will always be forever grateful for this program.

The allowance I received from TES helped lessen the burden of my family in providing my needs for my studies. In year 2019, I became pregnant with my first child. It was really hard for me to become a mother and a student at the same time. But because of my supportive parents and friends, I was able to continue my studies.

TES also helped in providing the needs of my son and my personal necessities. Through sacrifice and determination, I was able to finish my study. I graduated as Cum Laude in the course Bachelor of Secondary Education- Major in Mathematics in Mountain Province State Polytechnic College.

Lastly, I want to extend my heartfelt gratitude to entire TES Scholarship family for their significant contribution in attaining my dreams. May you continue to be a blessing to the students in reaching their goals."

JOVYLYN M. BAUNGOT
BACHELOR OF SECONDARY EDUCATION MAJOR IN MATHEMATICS
MOUNTAIN PROVINCE STATE POLYTECHNIC COLLEGE
CUM LAUDE

"I dreamt of finishing college to get my family out of poverty. I also questioned how I would be able to finish my studies if my parents couldn't afford to send me to school because there were so many expenses. God is good for He provided TES through our government. I am so grateful that I was one of the chosen grantees of the program. TES has inspired me to keep dreaming because everything will be provided for me until I graduate.

Because of TES, I finished my education and received a Leadership Award. This accomplishment helped me realize that you need not worry about how you're going to pay for your studies since our government is eager to make dreams come true. I want to thank CHED and UniFAST. Mabuhay ang mga kabataang may pangarap!"

Joan Cilo
King's College of the Philippines-Bambang, Inc
BSEd in English

"Tertiary Education Subsidy really helped me with my financial challenges and helped me continue my studies. If not for TES, I would have stopped during the pandemic to be able earn enough money so that I can re-enroll and continue my study.

The assistance from CHED-CAR UniFAST helped me buy materials that I need in my studies like books, and load, and helped me pay my tuition fee. Noong hindi pa ako grantee, nahihirapan akong makafocus sa studies dahil talagang nagsasabay ang work and study pero noong naging TES grantee na ako, mas nakapagfocus na ako sa studies ko. TES inspired to do my best in my academics because I believe that the best way to repay the financial support given to me is to study well.

Thank you, CHED-UniFAST, because you helped me make my dreams become reality. I also want to express my gratitude to the Student Development and Welfare Office of the University of Cordilleras for their unending support and help for us, UC TES Grantees. They have been a big part in our success.

I hope that there will be more students to be helped by this program."

VINSON S. RAMOS

UNIVERSITY OF THE CORDILLERAS

"Going to college is already a great milestone achieved, but it wont be easy, especially that it requires finance. As someone who really want to go to college, I had to find ways to meet the financial needs. I applied for few scholarship programs hoping that I might get lucky, and for God’s grace I was included as one of the CHED TDP grantees.

I was grateful that I was given the opportunity to enjoy college without much worry about financial need. I enrolled in a free education university and used the grant I received from TDP for book allowance, gadget, uniform, contributions, and many more.

As a blessed grantee, I am so grateful for the help because it helped me achieve my dream. I was also motivated to work hard for my grades in order to maintain my grant. No words can fully explain my gratitude for this opportunity. I am hoping that this program continues to help more of the students who need it. A big thanks."

GRAZEL T. DAGDAGUI

BENGUET STATE UNIVERSITY - MAIN

A PRESS CONFERENCE HOSTED BY: MS. HAZEL A. GUP-AY WITH DR. J. PROSPERO "POPOY" E. DEVERA III 2:00 PM WEDNESDAY HERE AT DZSM 92.1 GIMPONG FM RADIO ADDRESS MT. TALAMA, BULANAO, TABUK CITY, KALINGA - ALL STUDENTS ARE INVITED TO INTERACT AND SEND THEIR MESSAGES AND CONCERNS TO / HOTLINE NUMBER 0968-887-8713

All students are invited to tune in to Gimpong 92.1 FM Radio Station at 2:00 o'clock PM on March 2, 2022 for the live coverage of a press conference with Commission on Higher Education (CHED) Chairman J. Prospero E. De Vera III. Issues and concerns relative to the reopening of face-to-face classes, CHED Scholarship Programs for students and faculty, Implementation of Republic Act 10931 (Universal Access to Quality Tertiary Education Act), Establishment of a CHED Satellite Office in the Province of Kalinga, Tertiary Education Subsidy for students in Higher Education Institutions, among others will be discussed.

Thank you CHED UNIFAST Region VIII ❤️🤗👏

EDUCATION is the best INVESTMENT to be have in order for us to get pass toward the GOLDEN FUTURE that we dreamt of.

I am one of the student who experience a lot of DIFFICULTIES in life such as physically, mentally, emotionally and financially. As a student came from destitute family the TOUGHEST PROBLEM that I've always encountering is the LACK OF FINANCIAL support for my study. I am the youngest of our family and a proud member of LGBTQIA+ community. During my Elementary days Ang High School, my life is very miserable a lot of discrimination coming from my brother, classmates and the community but I never give up in pursuing my dream to finish my education someday despite of discrimination and lack of financial support because that is the roots why some of the student descriminated me. Maybe the students we're able to judge by how I look at physically and the things do I have to be used and wore at school. It's so sad that I just only 1 pair of old uniform and Don't have smart phone and gadget like laptop to be used for study maybe because of that they think I'm not so competent and valuable for them but I never mind those unnecessary words and action from them until one day I graduated in High School.

During the first day of my college life there's so many question in my mind if I can survive to finish a bachelor degree knowing the fact that college is more expensive than High School but I just telling myself that I can survive no matter what difficulties will be I have to finish a bachelor degree because this is my dream and I want to show the universe who didn't believing on me. I will raised up to conquer my highlight dream to give impact on society and make a difference that a person like me is having a chance a power to be one of the productive person in our country. I instilling my mind to never give up on my ambition and will do everything to achieve it because I want to be the inspiration of all especially the youth, I want to be the eye-opener to all especially for those people who discriminated me in the past that all negativity they brought to my life will never affect me but instead it gives me a reason to strengthen my fighting spirit to toward the golden future, and one day I'll be back to them to showcase all negative perspective from them are very wrong and I did it what I want to become. To sustain my financial needs for education I experienced selling a beauty products, foods and good things to earn money. I start a small business and the profit even 1 peso are very important for me, those profit I earn I invest it to finish my bachelor degree someday.

To have another possibilities as another source of income for my financial support I tried many time to apply any SCHOLARSHIP and I'm so GRATEFUL that I am one of the LUCKY GRANTEES of TES ( CHED PINASKolar Region VIII - Eastern Visayas) thank you so much from the bottom of my heart with the opportunity you given to me I feel how important and blessed and now I am confident that my highlight dream to finish a bachelor degree will be realize very soon because I am 1 step closer ahead on my dream. To the personnel who have it made happen the CHED- UniFast Tertiary Education Subsidy (TES) especially to Sir @ Prof Popoy De Vera thank you very many you give so much power to all students like me to keep on believing their dream to conquer, you give hope and a glimpse of sunshine as we vying the bachelor degree toward the golden future. With all the financial support I've received it motivates me to do my best to maintained a good performance academically, and it's a great help for my family to lessen their worries financially.

Today for some reason I am now stress-free for financial because of you TES CHED-UniFast. MABUHAY!! MABUHAY Tayong LAHAT, MABUHAY PINASKolar, MABUHAY PILIPINAS....💕💕🙏🙏🌟🌟

#ProudTESGrantee
#CHEDUniFAST
#ChedPinaskolar

Vicente Cotchesa Quanim
TES Grantee
Bachelor of Technology and Livelihood Education- IV
Palompon Institute of Technology- Tabango Campus ( PIT-TC)

"No matter how cruel life could be, God will surely send instruments to lead you to a brighter way!"

Not to brag, but to inspire. I graduated Senior High School with flying colours. Being in a family that is unprivileged, it is such an honor to witness how proud your parents are. That despite of life's uncertainties we've encountered, we still manage to pursue our dreams. My tatay was a farmer, and my nanay was a pure housewife. Basically, we are struggling financially, but I am proud to say that our parents still send us, three ('cause I have 2 siblings) to school despite of every hindrances that life gives us. The reason why I am posting this post.
As I started my college journey, life has been very tough, really. I felt being unwanted. I experienced what estrangement feels like, maybe because of my social status, having less privileges where I cannot get along with my studies, most specially with the learning modality we are having right now. I didn't manage to attend virtual classes for the reason that we do not have stable internet connection and we only use mobile data which is limited only. Furthermore, I also didn't complete the tasks given to me because I lack gadgets and the needed materials and equipments to be used for it. Honestly, dropping out was on my mind that time...
But then, CHED-UNIFAST Tertiary Education Subsidy (TES), come along my way. I was chosen as one of the beneficiaries. My parents and I really cried hard that time, tears of joy. That help, really boast my hope on reaching my family and I's dream. It boasted my hope on pursuing my heart's desires despite of any difficulties I am facing, and about to face. Indeed, I am blessed and will always be, for God had sent instruments who'll serve as one of my stepping stone upon reaching new heights in life. Thus, I would be forever grateful and will surely treasure this forever. I will definitely exert doubled efforts on my studies. I will soar high as a TESian!
Mabuhay ang TES grantees!

Vernalyn T. Andriano
Bachelor of Science in Economics - 2nd Year
Visayas State University (Main Campus)

Had a fruitful discussion on integrating Filipino Professionals in Canada during the Filipino-Canadian Professionals Convention with Consul General Orontes Castro, Philippine Consulate General of Toronto; PRC Chairperson Charito A. Zamora; Hon. David Smith, MPP Parliamentary Assistant to the Ontario Minister of Labor, Immigration, Training and Skills Development and; City of Vaughan Deputy Mayor Mario Felice Ferri.

Now, in my second visit here in Ontario, CHED's third mission for this same purpose, as you can see, we are serious in pushing for more concrete steps moving forward for our Filipino professionals.

This is another opportunity to further negotiate with counterparts and hasten the strides not only for nurses but also for Filipino professionals - to our Teachers, Architects, Accountants, Construction Professionals, Dental Hygienists, Physiotherapists, Engineers, Peace Officers, Realtors and many more.

Make a stand 👇🏻💪

Gusto ko pong ibalita sa inyo na unti-unting bumubuti na ang aking kondisyon mula nung ako ay nagpositibo sa COVID-9. Tuloy tuloy na ang mga meeting ng CHED, mga pagsangguni sa mga pamantasan, at pati na media interviews kahit paos ang boses. Patuloy din ang paghikayat natin sa mga HEIs na ituloy ang school-based vaccination program at pagmonitor sa epekto ng COVID-19 upang gabayan ang ating education stakeholders sa mga nararapat gawin para matuloy ang pagaaral ng ating mga kabataan.

Gusto kong personal na pasalamatan ang mga ekspertong tumulong sa aking paggaling- sina OLFU President Carol Enriquez, Dr. Marlon Tiu, ang magaling na pulmonologist na gumabay sakin via TeleMed, Dr. Mike Tee, PGH Director Gap Legaspi, Dr. Agnes Mejia, at ang aking anak na si Doc IC de Vera. Taos pusong pasasalamat din sa lahat ng inyong dasal at mensahe ng suporta para sa aking paggaling.

Magpabakuna tayong lahat at pagtulungang labanan ang COVID-19.

"Black is not out but the black is in, black it's symbolizes the color of our success " 2018
Magna cum laude
Cum laude
Loyalty award
Appreciation award
.. iilan lamang sa mga award na natanggap ng aking mga kasamang grumaduate ❤️ super proud❣️. Ako, ito graduate lang, masaag pas linya, na late pa😅 
Pero sa totoo lang hindi ko masabing " grumaduate LANG" sa Dami ng aking naranasan at pagsubok na napagdaanan panalangin at luha Ang kasangga🥲🥺 grabe akong kalisud nga naagian, grabe Ang luha nga migula sa akong mata, singot nga miagas sa akong lawas, kakapoy sa matag adlaw nga makigbisug sa panahon makab-ot lang ANG gitinguhang graduation ❤️❣️ 
Dili Dali ug dili sayon Ang makig bisug sa panahon samot nag financial Ang imong problema ug nangandoy ka sa langit nga nasayud man unta ka unsa kini kalayo🥺 sa panahon nga naa kos akong hard time, pag ampo ug hilak lang jud akong madangpan😘 
...... BIG YES sa pagka working student ‼️ 14 years naging working student ko, since when I was grade 4. Super blessed ko atong mga panahona Kay didto naku nasayran unsa kalisud kung dili ka muhuman ug eskwela. 
Gusto lang jud ko mu story sa akong life😭😭😭 dugay na nako Ning gikimkim sa akong kasing-kasing, sulod sa 15 yrs. 14 yrs sa akong pagka working student ug 1 yr sa akong pagka minyo. Gusto naku iShare to encourage everyone despite sa kalisud sa panahon padayon lang jud.
First day, week, month, year nga nagsugod kog working student na bag-ohan ko Kay daghan kaayug trabaho, pero naghuna-huna ko kung dili ko magpadayon dili ko makahuman ug eskwela mao lang gihapon akong trabaho puhon. Tinuod kapoy kaayu🥲🥲 Kay Ang imong utok ug lawas Ang mulihok. Humag trabaho sa imong lawas sa mga trabahuon sa balay, lihok na sad imong utok sa trabahuon sa eskwelahan. Kapoy jud sya pero laban ra jud💪 
Makahinomdom ko sa una, tong first month palang namo nag-uban ni ma'am, permi Gina ingon ni ma'am sa akoa nga "eskwela jud del, pagtarong ug eskwela, paningkamot para makatabang ka sa imong pamilya, pag eskwelag tarong Kay para gihapon Nas imuha" very inspired kos mga pulong ni ma'am, ug sya Ang Isa ka hinungdan nganung gusto jud ko makahuman ug eskwela. Sa 14 yrs namo nga panag-uban pipila na pud Ang utang ni ma'am Maka exam lang kos eskwelahan. Oo, tinuod dili Kwartahan si ma'am, pero willing kaayu sya mupa eskwela naku. Nakahinumdom ko sa una, college pud si Ay-Ay college pud ko. Ang financial ni ma'am grabe ka kabusy jud, pero still nilaban ming tulo. Niuna ug graduate si Ay-Ay, second year ko ato, gi encourage ko ni ma'am nga human na daw iyang anak Ako na pud daw sunod. Ibog kaayu Kong Ay-Ay Kay nakasuot na pud syag tuga, maong naningkamot jud ko, gawas nga naibog ko para dili sad masayang Ang gasto Kay dili lalim naay college 😭 maong nilaban ko bisan ug kapoy na Kay tungod ni ma'am ug ni papa😭😭😭 
Salamat mam Nena Eulogio Perandos salamat sa pagpahuman naku ma'am, salamat sa mga tambag, salamat sa sakripisyo ❣️❤️dili kabayran imong gibuhat ma'am ug Sir, nang Helen Perandos Juntilla , uncle Lito, uncle Ebeth and all. Balikan tamo puhon po. Mingawon kaayu ko nimo ninyu po😭😭 salamat sa inyung tanan... Kamo unta akong nakauban sa akong graduation kung wala lang ko na slide gamay. Pero thankful kos akong pamilya karon ug small family Kay very ka supportive. 
Ingon pas si papa sa una, dili lang daw sya maghikay sa akong graduation sa grade 6, 10 ug 12 Kay sa college na daw, Isa ka rason nganung gusto kaayu ko makahuman. naghandom ko, pero Wala ko nagdahom Ang hikay para sa akong graduation sa college Kay gihikay sa 1st death anniversary ni papa😭😭 Ang Pina ka sakit pa, dili lang daw sya mupaso sa akoa Kay  graduation nalang daw sa college😭😭 pero Wala tanan, nawala tanan Kay niunag lakaw c papa, niuna syag panaw😭😭 kmaan sleng jud🙄😭
Gikaluy-an, pagka second year college naapil kos scholarship "UNIFAST"nasulbad ra jud among financial maong Wala na pud Koy rason para muundang❣️❤️
Pagka -third year college namatay c papa, nihawa ko Kay ma'am. Nakig bisug na pud kos panahon nga Ako ra. Pero dili naku kaya maong pagka 4th year college nagminyo. Nagminyo dili Kay tungod para muundang kog eskwela kundili nagminyo ko para naa Koy karamay sa akong pag eskwela. Wala ko nakig minyo sa akong bana para lang sa akong pag eskwela. Nakig minyo ko niya Kay tungod sa iyang kabuutan, pagka mapalanggaon ug support sya sa akong pag eskwela. Maong bisag buntis ko ug naa nakoy anak Wala gihapon ko ni STOP. Ana ko ka devoted❤️ 
Ug hangtud naabot sa time nga gikapoy na jud ko. Wala nakoy gana mu-eskwela Kay permi ko mabilar, nag suffer na pud kos financial Kay naa Koy Bata gigatas. Naka bana Kong Venzkie Tolentino very ka supportive. Wala sad ko ni surrender Kay nakabayaw kog mga BUOTAN big thanks Kay ate Gemma Tolentino helping me financially, Cyrille Marcellana Tolentino Sirot helping me through ups and down, sa akong pag nganak naa sya sa akong kiliran. Ug hangtud naa nakoy anak bisag busy kaayu sya igo ra naku ihatud Ang Bata undang tanang trabaho Kay naa na pud c baby tabudi❣️ nanay Leny, salamat nay sa mga tabang Donna Clair Timtim Panganduyon , and jovani  akong masangpit maghimo ug IM'S ug salamat sa imong pagka manghinatagun dhang.. ate Vanessa Tolentino  encourage me always, Chona Marcellana Tolentino very supportive sa akong pag buntis ug pag eskwela 🥰 sa akong mga uncle ante salamat sa tanan... 
Ug bisan pa man sa mga pagtamay sa akoa, sa akong pamilya, salamat Ginoo Kay Wala Jud ko nagpadaug🥲❣️. Wala mi nasayud unsay reason nganung dili sila ganahan namo. Permi mi ginatabi nila, permi sila maglagot namo sa una. Kung mangabo mi sa reservoir Kay ginapadaplin among gallon bisag Pinaka una mi, Pina ka worst diha Kay gilabay pa jud among gallon Kay dili mi pakab-on Kay Wala pa daw mi kabayad sa tubig😭🥲.. Daghan niingon nga mabuntisan rako nga walay amahan, nagtuga-tuga ug eskwela bisag walang-wala na, feeling Datu, feeling gwapa, pamati na kaayu, dili nana makahuman ug eskwela Kay nagminyo na, nya nabuntis na pud, sus Jusko! Tama jud ilang giingon "ayaw hukmi Ang tawo!"  Wala lang jud mo kabalo unsa ko ka devoted, unsa akong struggle nga giagian para lang Makahuman. Yes, dili pa ni sya matawag nga successful, but, I do believe the sayings that "black toga it's symbolizes the color of our success 🥰💪"
BIG THANKS TO THE LORD ALMIGHTY FATHER, PERMI MUTUBAG SA AKONG MGA PAG-AMPO. 
YES, THE LONG WAITS IS OVER🥰❣️
ALL GLORY TO THE GOD ALMIGHTY
DELLY P. MALAGANTE
BACHELOR OF SECONDARY EDUCATION
MAJOR IN FILIPINO
BATCH 2022

Good and great day to everyone, I just want to share my experienced before I got the unifast scholarship. I was raised in a poor family but we were happy because we have each other and I'm so thankful and blessed for that. After I graduated high school year 2015 I went to manila to seek for a job to help my family . And God is always good, although I was under age that time I luckily have one . I work there as a house helper for one year . I save a little and the rest I gave to my family. After one year I decided to go home because that time I was already eighteen and I was thinking to apply for a job with atleast a minimum wage salary. Year 2016, I heard a news from my uncle that there's a job hiring in a shop in mandaue city with free accomodations , food and fare from leyte to cebu with a monthly salary of 2,500 pesos. I was jobless that time so I grab the opportunity, I work as an auto mechanic. After five months I decided to resign , and apply for a job with atleast a minimum wage salary. I have five thousand pesos savings that time , I use it to apply for a job . So luckily I got a job in super value inc. also known as sm supermarket in consolacion. I was so motivated that time that I can't stop thinking about going to college. In conclusion I enrolled in mandaue city college, at same time I'm working at sm consolacion as a bagger. It was so hard for me, because I have a tight schedule of my study and my work. I remember so well early in the morning at exactly 5 am I wake up because I have a class at 7 am to 12 and my work is at 1pm to 10 pm a closing bagger that time . There were times that things get rough and hard , especially in terms of financial . There were times that I beg for food because I have nothing in my pocket but I can't lose my studies . I get to the point that I got sick ,no money, hopeless, so hard that time. I gave up my studies and continue my work . After my contract I used my savings to apply for a job again I was thinking that time that maybe it's not the right time to pursue my studies . In conclusion I work in Sunpride Foods Incorporated for six months , Monde Nissin for six months , and Alpha Foods Incorporated for nine months . After that I went home to rest because I was tired that time . I feel hopeless especially those times that I have seen my high school batchmates have already graduated in college. I feel tired and hopeless and I was thingking that maybe it is the life that God choosen for me . One day I was playing billiard with my friend I opened up my problems and that friend of mine told me that don't lose hope . I can't forget the things he have said on me telling "di naman karera yung college pre na kailangan mong mauna yung iba nga kahit 40 years old na nag aaral parin ". I was stopped by the moment thingking he is right , so without hesitation I applied for college . I tried to apply in Southern Leyte State University but I have failed ,yet I didn't give up I apply again in Bato Institute of Science and Technology and luckily I have enrolled. Year 2019 I have already enrolled in Bist Leyte with a program of Bachelor of Science in Business Administration , I am so happy and motivated . At first I didn't worry about my tuition although it's a private school because I have a little savings on me that can cover my whole year tuition. At the end of the school year I'm worried , thingking how about my tuition fee in second year? I can't lose this time this is the only way I can chase my dreams and help my family. I remember so well in the summer there was a job hiring in our town there's a vacant position for a construction worker . Although I went through different work but I have never tried being a construction worker before . But I was so motivated to pursue my studies that even the hardest job in the world I will grab it for my studies. In conclusion I work as a construction worker for almost two months and that money leads me to enroll for my second year it was so hard but it's okay atleast I enrolled, the only thing that goes in my mind is to continue my studies. In the time of enrollment I apply for scholarships to support me with my tuition fees, and God is great all the time because he gives this life saving scholarship called Unified Student Financial Assistance System for Tertiary Education (UniFAST),. I was so blessed and so happy that I got a chance be one of the beneficiary of UniFAST, and the only thing I can pay back is to focus on my studies and share to others my experiences to motivate them. Now I'm a fourth year student, thanks to unifast for saving me and all the people who creates this scholarship especially to commissioner chairman in higher education prof popoy de vera and to almighty God for always helping me on those days that I can't stand on my own. I hope and pray that the government will not stop this scholarship program because it means a lot for filipinos who have difficulties in pursuing their dreams especially in terms of financial incapabilities. And lastly I would like to thank everyone for reading this message and I hope this motivates you to pursue your dreams . To God be the glory🙏🙏🙏🙏🙏🙏!!!!!!
#IStandWithUniFAST
#proudunifastscholar
#ToGodBeTheGlory
#proudbistnian

“Alhamdulillāh for every blessing, every trial, and everything in between.”
For some, the Marawi siege was simply a footnote in history, but for us, it was a heinous incident. For some, it may have been just a news headline, but for us, it was a nightmare we are yet to be free from. For some, it was Martial Law, but for us, it was trauma and everything that comes with it. It was a different type of agony. It was excruciatingly painful to lose a home. The sounds of bombs and gunshots are still echoing through our ears. It felt like the sun rose a little slower during those months and months of waiting, of wanting to be home. It has divided our family in order for us to survive. It has drastically changed our lives. We went back to zero and had to start from scratch. There could never be any type or amount of compensation that could compensate for the brokenness, homesickness, damage, bruises, and even the discrimination we experienced.
Indeed, there is beauty in every struggle because the Marawi siege was also a turning point for me, making my faith stronger and thus more steadfast. It has taught me life lessons that I would have never learned otherwise. It has made me value life and my family even more. It has taught me to be patient, mature, and resilient. It has set my goals straight and firm. Alhamdulillāh, we have family and close relatives who were more than willing to lend a helping hand during those challenging times.
I entered college when we were at our lowest, but Alhamdulillāh, out of thousands of students at the university, I was one of the Tertiary Education Subsidy (TES) grantees. Being one of the TES grantees as a Marawi Siege victim is an honor and a great privilege. It has made my college expenses a less burdensome to my parents. It has enabled me to meet my own needs and even wants. It has also become my responsibility to always give my best effort and strive in my academic pursuits. I will be perpetually grateful UniFAST  and maraming maraming salamat po Former President Rodrigo Roa Duterte #FPRRD
To my friends who not only helped me achieve academic excellence but also inspired me and continue bringing me closer to Allah (S.W.T), congratulations to us, and way to go! 🖤
To my Family, I cannot thank my parents, Ome Faridah Sharief and Abe Ali Pangompig, enough for all of your sacrifices and for always believing in me. To the best Tita and Tito a pamangkin could ever ask for, the best cook/advisor/second momma/problem solver Tita Fatma Zahra , and the best advisor/second father/kuya/photographer Tito Dodi Sharief Mala , words cannot express how grateful I am to you both for literally everything. To Aa Farhanadi Ali Sharief  (Ate no. 1) for all the unpaid make-up services, as well as for providing WiFi just so I could survive the depressing internet connection during the online class. To Rhn Sha  (Ate no. 2) for the financial support, for always motivating and encouraging me, for never putting pressure on me, and for paving the way. To Nor-hanah Sharief Ali  (Ate no. 3) for always styling my hijab, always listening to my rants, and always the one who gives way between us. To Aiman Radiamoda  (Kuya no. 1), for always being the "naghahatid" whenever I have an academic-related event to attend. To Junainah Ali Sharief  for the flowers and to my little sisters. To my late paternal grandmother, who never got to see me wear a toga, and to my late maternal grandmother, who is the first person I hug and kiss every time I graduate. All of this was made possible because I have such a great support system. In my little ways, I hope I made you all proud. Thank you so much for your unwavering support and unparalleled love. 💖
Thank you also for the overwhelming messages from my former mentors, relatives, friends, batchmates, classmates, and acquaintances.  Appreciated. 🙏
Above all, Alhamdulillāh ‘ala kulli hal, to the Almighty Allah (S.W.T), to whom all glory and honor rightfully belong, the source of all wisdom, strength, and guidance. 🤲
MAIMANAH RADIAMODA ALI
Mindanao State University-Main Campus
Bachelor of Science in Business Administration major in Human Resource Management
Academic Excellence awardee

Heart Status: Full of Gratitude

Ang makapagtapos ng kolehiyo ay isa sa mga pangarap ko upang maiahon sa kahirapan ang aking pamilya. Nalagpasan ko ang mga kahit anong pagsubok at naging posible ang lahat dahil sa Universal Access to Quality Tertiaty Education Act (RA 10931) at sa Tertiary Education Subsidy (TES) na binubuo ng Commission on Higher Education(CHED) and UniFAST.

Gusto kong magpasalamat sa aking pamilya, at sa mga kamag-anak ko dito sa Tagaytay at Laguna na walang sawang sumusuporta sa akin hanggang sa ako'y makapagtapos.

Kay Kap. Ester Serondo Marasigan na palaging nandiyan upang e extend ang kanyang unending love and supports sa akin lalong lalo na noong kasagsagan ng pandemya.

Sa mga CCT profs na palaging nandiyan upang magbigay guidance sa akin especially to sir Jepoy Añonuevo , sir RM De Castro, at ma'am Heizel Garcia, at sa mga naging profs ko na napaka pasensyuso at considerate sa aming mga estudyante.

Kay Mayor Abraham "Bambol" Tolentino , Vice Mayor Agnes Tolentino, DMD , Cong. Aniela Tolentino , Vice Gov. Athena Tolentino , at kay Sen. Francis Tolentino , maraming maraming salamat po. Utang na loob ko po ang makapag-aral ng libre sa inyung institusyong City College of Tagaytay.

Sa mga kaklase ko rin na naging mabubuti kung kaibigan, at sa lahat na nagpapakita ng suporta.

At hindi ko rin makakalimutang magpapasalamat sa ating Panginoon.

Nelmar S. Atanoza
Bachelor of Science in Computer Science
City College of Tagaytay
2021-2022

Bilang isang mag aaral, gadgets ay isa sa mga kailangan ng isang studyante lalong lalo na sa kolehiyo. Bilang isang studyante na pinapalaki ng magulang na hindi sagana sa ano mang bagay ay talagang mahirap. Sa paggawa ng mga laboratory reports, cellphone lang gamit ko sa paggawa at mahirap talaga sapagkat ang cellphone ko ay luma na. Dahil nga sa estado ng buhay ko, naisipan kong maghanap ng extrang pagkakitaan para ma sustentuhan ko ang sariling kong pangangailangan. Pero ngayun nagiba ang takbo ng aking mundo sapagkat isa ako sa benefeciary ng TES. Dahil sa TES nakabili ako ng laptop at cellphone na pweding gamitin sa pagaaral lalong lao na ngayung pandemya na ang paraan ng pagaaral ay sa pamqmagitan ng online. Nasusustentuhan ko qng ang aking pangangailangan lalong lalo na ang load na kinakailqngan upang makapsaok sa sychronous discussion, pagtake ng exam at quizzes, pag dowload ng mga learning Task at assessment. Napapasalamat ako sa Programa galing CHED dahil naipagpatuloy ko ang aking pagaaral kahit sa kahirapan dahil sa ating sitwasyon ngayon.

Jason Mark V. Cañas
Visayas, State, University
Visca, Baybay Vity, Leyte
BS Agriculture

"Don't stop chasing your dreams because of poverty".

I was born in a family whose not capable enough in nurturing children in terms of financial support, chasing dreams is like searching a needle in a bundles of hays.
Our life is so hard, my parents are not a degree holder. It is because we are poor we cannot buy what we need and if my parents find money they only spent that one in our foods. When I go to school, i bring some sweet potatoes and cassava as my rice. I am helping my mother getting sweet potatoes and sell it to the people, amd when my father is working I am the one who care our carabao. I witnessed how difficult our life is and how my parents struggled just to provide food to us. Even though our life is like "Isang kahig, Isang Tuka", my parents still find a way just to send us to school. Despite of all the problems that I encountered, still I am strong enough to overcome those. Then, after I graduate high school, my parents told me to stop studying because of financial problem. I didn't listen to them instead I find ways and I enrolled myself to college. I stayed at my grandparents house for me to be free and can't pay any boarding house. I went to school with a small amount of money, and that money is only for the motorcycle fare.
With all then problems that I encountered, I still able to continue studying. Until an opportunity came, a door of opportunity opens. Granting assistance under CHED-UniFAST Tertiary Education Subsidy (TES) arise. I am one of the chosen grantees. As always not everyone is given privilege to obtain such opportunity as a TES grantee, but luckily I was blessed enough, I am thankful enough to be one of the chosen individual who can chase their dreams. That CHED-UNIFAST Tertiary Education Subsidy gives me hope, gives me light, open a door for me to follow my dreams.

"Pangarap ko lang noon at nakamit ko na ngaun"

Maraming humadlang sa pagpupursige kung mag aral sa College kesyo my anak na ako? Hindi yan mkapagtapos ng pag aaral? wala yang pang gastos sa school? magbabarkada lng yan? umiiwas mag alaga ng mga anak? pabayang ina sa mga anak? bubuntisan lng yan? yan ang mga salitang tumatak sa isipan ko ng mga taong gusto akung ilugmok sa kahirapan at ayaw akung bigyan ng pagkakataon sa aking pangarap upang mabangon ko ang aking pamilya. Nagbigay ng daan at inspirasyon ang masasakit na salita saken upang maging matatag at patibayin ang loob ko sa mga walang kwentang paratang at mga panghusga nila sa sarili ko. Taong 2017 ng mamatay ang aking papa isa din siya sa mga dahilan kung bakit nagpursige akung mag aral dahil bago siya malagutan ng hininga sinabi niya saken ipagpatuloy ko ang plano namin na mag aral ako ng College kahit wala siya at kahit marami ang mga hadlang. Then, sabi ko sa sarili ko San ako kukuha pa ng panggastos? at sabi ng Papa ko tiwala lng nak my ibibigay sau c Lord na Blessings continued praying. Sa mga oras na andun ako sa school biglang tumawag saken ang friend ko at sabi niya 'Day kasali ka sa listahan ng TES GRANTEES andun ang pangalan mu' at mabilis akung nagtungo sa gate finally kasali nga ako, sobrang tuwa ko dahil sa pagdadasal ko na balang araw mabigyan man lang katuparan ang mga ninais ko sa buhay. Thanks God at hindi niya ako binigo I am proud to be a TES GRANTEES at malaking tulong ang naidulot nito sa pag aaral ko. Kahit maraming pagsubok ang dinaanan hindi ako bumitaw sa anumang mga paratang dahil sa pagtitiyaga at pagtitiis na aking naranasan bandang huli ay aking nakamtan.

Thank you so much TES at CHEDUnifast dahil sa organization niyo daming mga estudyante ang mga natulungan, nabigyan ng katuparan ang mga pangarap at magandang kinabukasan God bless us all. Kaya sa mga baguhan pa diyan kahit anung pagsubok ang dumaan huwag mawalan ng pag asa laban lang po tayo at higit sa lahat ay magdasal💪💪💪🙏🙏🙏😘😘😘❤️❤️❤️

Aivie Sidmanao Oljol
Bachelor of Science in Office Administration
SY: 2020-2021
Northwest Samar State University, Main Campus Calbayog City

I am Catherine D. Gagante from Dr. Emilio B. Espinosa Sr. Memorial State College of Agriculture and Technology (DEBESMSCAT). I am taking up Bachelor of Secondary Education majoring Mathematics.

Isa po akong TES grantee ng aming paaralan. Nais ko pong magpasalamat sa TES/CHED dahil sa malaking tulong na ipinagkaloob sa aking pag aaral at maging sa aking kalusugan. Bumili ako ng cellphone para sa aking sarili pati na rin ang aking mga pamangkin upang may magamit sa online class. Nakapag pa check up rin po ako dahil sa aking dinaramdam na Ulcer, at sa ngayon po super thankful po ako dahil magaling na po ako. Nakabili rin ako ng Flash Drive and power bank. At yung natirang cash po ay inilaan ko para sa load for online class. Napakalaking tulong po ang binigay niyo sa aming lahat na grantees.💗

Hello everyone ako nga pala si Queencie Mae Ogabar Uriarte nag aaral sa Eastern Samar State University Guiuan Campus kinuha kung kurso ay Bachelor Science Tourism Management I'm third year College na😊 
Malaking tulong sa akin Yung TES Scholarship I didn't expect na masasali ako, kase isipin mo sa dami Ng tao sa campus higit 5k ka tao di ko Yun inisip na makukuha ako na makaka avail ako Ng ganun, it was first time kase first year palang ako nun first time ko Ng ganun, tapos mababalitaan ko nalang na ang TES scholarship ay Hanggang sa pag graduate ko.
Thank you TES kase dahil Sayo nabayaran utang Namin sa kahoy, matagal na Yung utang Namin na Yun, tumutubo Yung interest kada Buwan kaya Wala talagang natira kase Isang bagsakan Yung first avail ko dahil sa utang Namin.hehehe Hindi ako nagreklamo na Wala akong natanggap Kay mama kahit Piso kase ganun talaga buhay Namin.
Thank you TES kase Yung second avail ko sa first year binili ko Ng cellphone ko at pati rin Kapatid ko sapagkat Wala talaga kami cellphone para sa pagaaral, mayroon ako ginagamit nun mga bigay bigay lang second hand ganun pero dahil talaga sa TES kahit nakakatawa first time ko magkaroon Ng bago as in bago talaga.
Thank you TES first avail ko sa second year nakabili kami Ng mga bigas tsaka bills pinaayos rin Namin Ang maliit naming bangka tsaka mga gamit narin dahil Hindi pa kami nakaka ahon nung bagyong Ursula, Thank you TES sapagkat nung time talaga nun Walang Wala kami ikaw lang talaga hinihintay Namin marami kase kaming mga utang sa tindahan humihina na kase talaga Ang hanap buhay sa pangingisda kahit ngayon.
Thank you TES kase ngayong second avail ko this second year babayaran Namin Yung utang Namin sa tindahan tagal na kase nun siguro mahaba na, nahihiya na Rin kami hehehe pero andyan ka Naman e hinihintay ka Namin ni mama TES hahahaha. Tsaka pambili Ng bigas Namin Walang Wala talaga kami tsaka bills Ng tubig at kuryente pati rin motor na matagal na naming hulugan, minsan na kase kaming naputulan Ng kuryente at tubig actually alternate lang Yun at Hindi ko Yun ikakahiya kahit sabihin pa Yun Ng iba samin sapagkat Hindi Naman kami magyayabang sa mga tao kung Wala talaga.
Kaya malaking THANK YOU TES Walang sawang pasasalamat sapagkat marami po kayong natutulungan at Lalo na po sa pamilya ko at pagaaral ko, natutulungan nyo po ang mga estudyante sa pagaaral at Lalong Lalo na sa mga pamilya Namin Lalo na't minsan financial talaga Ang nagiging problema.
Ngayon po labis at sobra Ang pasasalamat naming mga estudyante sapagkat kabilang kami sa TES.
Salamat sa oras Ng pagbabasa mo sa buhay ko Kasama Ang TES, wag kang magalala kung Hindi ka kasali wait for your time makaka avail ka Rin😊  ako nga pala ulit si Queencie Mae Ogabar Uriarte nag aaral sa Eastern Samar State University Guiuan Campus kinuhang kurso ay Bachelor Science Tourism Management I'm third year College this year😊  btw. 2019 pa yung picture It was first year ❤️
Thank you Rin po ma'am analie golosino nicart sa mga concerns at sacrifices Lalo na po sa understanding at patience sapagkat nahahandle nyo po kaming lahat Ng TES grantees sa ESSU GUIUAN.

"Before entering college, I was initially doubtful, knowing that we had a financial crisis and could not sustain my college days. But then I learned about TDP subsidy through the government's announcement that they would help students who could not support their college degree. Thus, I was eager to join, so I completed the requirements and waited to be one of the grantees.

After learning I am one of the TDP grantees, I was glad and thankful because it can now aid my financial need, especially my tuition fee. Every time I check my account, the scholarship has already paid my tuition fee. It inspired me more to pursue my dreams and achieve more incredible things. Now, I thank CHED for choosing me to be their scholar and for supporting students in chasing their dreams."

JEREMIAH F. MARIN
CUM LAUDE
BACHELOR OF SCIENCE IN PSYCHOLOGY
SAINT LOUIS UNIVERSITY

Thank you so much to the people behind making Article XIV of the 1987 Philippine Constitution. Also, thanks to our beloved former President Rodrigo Roa Duterte for signing Republic Act 10931 and, of course, to the legislative body that enacted this RA. Through the program of this RA, I both benefited from free higher education and the tertiary education subsidy. Thanks also to those in charge, government employees who extend their effort beyond their service to make sure that these programs will surely reach and help those poor but deserving Filipino students, just like me, now a degree holder. And so, my fellow graduate grantees, maybe there are many ways we can give back to our beloved state. Maybe it's time to stop asking what our country can do for us and instead start thinking about what we can do for our country.

#CHEDUniFAST

"I was privileged enough to be one of those people given a chance to take their education at a free-tuition university. I lived a very unfortunate life. My father is a construction worker and my mother is a housewife. I have seven siblings and I am the youngest so it wasn't easy. When the pandemic happened, our money was not enough to support my education so I got a job. Working and studying required a lot of time management, perseverance, determination and self-motivation. The experience wasn't easy but I made it through.

I just want to express my gratitude to CHED-UniFAST. Being a TES grantee since 2018 is a big blessing for me and my family. I am also thankful to the NORSU Scholarship Office for its support. Don't lose hope and don't give up on your dreams. Keep on fighting and keep on believing in yourself."

Boy Montes

Hello😊  I'm one of the TES grantees of Region VIII. I was came from a poor family, my father is a farmer and my mother is a house maid. Pero kahit na mahirap we still keep on fighting parin whatever happen para sa pangarap. TES is very helpful dahil marami ang na tulongan na mga studyante. Ang pera na natanggap ko galing sa TES ay ginagamit ko sa pagkaroon ng konting negosyo gaya ng ukay-ukay at online business upang maymapagkunan ng pera sa pangangailangan araw-araw lalo na sa gastusin sa paaralan. I want to grant my parents wish na bagohin ang bahay namin dahil sirang-sira na ang bahay dahil hanggang ngayon hindi pa namin na i ayos ang bahay namin. Kaya nagpapasalamat ako sa TES na isa ako sa napili nila at sobrang thankful ako dahil nakakatulong ito nang malaki sa akin at masaya ang aking mga pamilya na isa ako sa TES greatness. Simula ng akoy naka tanggap na nang blessings galing sa TES ay hindi na ako humigingi ng pera sa aking mga magulang . Again thank you so much and godbless TES❤

NEWS FEATURE: The Business Continuity Planning Module completes the 2nd Module of the YEP-Project MARITES Training on August 1, 2022. Mr. Jeremiah Paul “Jaypee” Morales, Owner of Rite Tea and the President of the Association of Filipino Franchisers, Inc. (AFFI), served as the mentor on the said topic and emphasised the importance of planning in maintaining a business. 
In the said module, mentees are taught to draft their business continuity plan for their businesses that will serve as a safety net to protect their businesses from unprecedented events. 
This four-module training is part of the agreement of the Commission on Higher Education - CAR and the Department of Trade and Industry - CAR, in coordination with the State Universities and Colleges in the Region.

As one of its programs under the Universal Access to Quality Tertiary Education Act, our government is providing a grant-in-aid program to support students in their tertiary education. 
SUCs, LUCs LGU-run TVIs and TESDA TTIs:
● Allowance for books, supplies, transportation, and miscellaneous personal expenses, including a reasonable allowance for the documented rental or purchase of personal computer or laptop, and other education-related expenses;
● Allowance for room and board costs incurred by the student.
Private HEIs and TVIs:
🔸Students enrolled in private HEIs and TVIs are entitled to the following benefits (Sections 23 and 24. IRR of RA 10931):
● Tuition and other school fees, which shall be equivalent to the tuition and other school fees of the nearest SUC and State-run TVI in their respective area.
● Allowance for books, supplies, transportation, and miscellaneous personal expenses, including a reasonable allowance for the documented rental or purchase of personal computer or laptop, and other education-related expenses
● Allowance for room and board costs incurred by the student.
