I AM MOTIVATED! I AM POWERFUL! I AM AUDACIOUS! I AM STEADFAST TO MY GOALS! I AM WHO I AM AND I SUCCEED!

" HINDI KA MAKAKAPAG TAPOS " This line has always been the adage of many towards me. I was once deemed that I will never achieve anything in life. Until one day, the most awaited moment of my life finally happen, who would have thought that I can now debunked the people who have instensely dislike, despise me and even call me nowhere to go in life.

Finally, after years of being completely confused and constantly living life with doubts from people. I am quite proud and grateful for whom I am now. Failure and failing is a process. And walling the most difficult situations in my journey is the best result I can give to the people who brought me in this situation.

Finishing my degree is no easy task at all; I took all my strength to hold on all the motivations that people fuelled me.

Reaching my goals this past year is not easy because of the unprecedented global health crisis and has tested my prowess to dance with the music of life. The surging of clamour on the streets down on my emotional health.

Bombarded with different task that land me in a state of optimal uncertainties as what future may bring. But yes, holding in your aspirations redefine your future.

Challenges are normal, it is the integral part of our life journey, without them, we will never grow, without failures, we will never learn, and without judgement, we will never become stronger. Silent battles have completely brought me to place where God blessed me with.

If there's a couple of support system on my journey it would be my Mother and my Father, they are a beacon of hope, pure love, strength and abilities to conquer the most oppressive stereotypes that could someone could feel about.

MA, Annie Catig PA, Arturo Suganob Catig para po ito sa inyo at sa lahat ng taong nagtiwala sa aking kakayahan sa loob ng apat na taon. I humbly dedicate this to you who loved me for who I am and what I am. I am nothing but a heart with outpouring gratitude and happiness.

Your love and advices are my guiding stars on my dreary roads. Thank you for always at my back, supporting me all the way is such a huge thing that will never left unrewarded. Kayo po ang naging inspirasyon ko sa lahat ng pagod, sa pag raraket na halos kinabukasan linalabanan ang antok dahil may pasok may pantustos lang sa pang araw - araw na gastusin sa paaralan. Hindi man madali ngunit nalagpasan.

To my family and my partner you have been my great source of strength and inspiration to surpassed the stormy ocean and tiresome long road.

To the Commission on Higher Education (CHED) and to the Tertiary Education Subsidy (TES) thank you for the opportunity you have given me as your grantee. Naway marami pa kayong matulungan.

To the Institution CEGUERA TECHNOLOGICAL COLLEGES, a place where goodness and positivity can be found. A home to satisfied our will and eventually to open a doorway nurturing our skills, cultivate knowledge, and teach us to craft our own masterpiece in life. Thank you so much.

Sa lahat po ng nagtiwala at naging masaya sa banayad na pagsabay ng panahon sa mataimtim na agos ng aking mga pangarap kalakip ng paulit ulit na pagkapunit.

SARILING PAGOD, PAGSUSUMIKAP, AT PAG PUPURSIGE. MARAMING SALAMAT PO. 😭🙏

CATIG ALLAN PAUL ANDALIS
BACHELOR OF SCIENCE IN BUSINESS ADMINISTRATION MAJOR IN MARKETING MANAGEMENT.
BATCH 2022.🎓

To God be the Glory.😇

Good evening po mga ma'am/sir. Sana matulungan niyo po ako sa concern ko po. Last August 2020 po nagsubmit po ako ng requirement sa naka-in-charge po sa department po namin. Pero di ko po namalayan na naipasa kong documentary requirement po pala noon ay certificate of indigency. Di na rin po naverify nung pinagpasahan ko na indigency yung document kasi same content po sa certificate of residency na naipasa ng mga taga-barangay ko po na permanent resident kaya tinanggap po nila. Magkaiba lang title ng document. Di na rin po ako nainform para ayusin iyun. Nalaman ko lang po at ng mga nasa registration office po ng school namin na certificate of indigency iyun nung vinerify na po nung April 2021. Hoping na maayos po dahil old grantee din po ako at ito lang po inaasahan ng pamilya ko po. Lalo na ngayon na may summer class po kami. Sana maayos at mapabilang po ako sa TES AY 2020-2021. Hindi ko na po alam gagawin ko. Exam na po sa summer class namin. Wala po kaming mapagkukuhanan. Sana talaga po maawa sa akin ang CHED - UNIFAST😢😢😢

🔶KWENTONG TES 🔶
A blessed day to everybody, may we find peace and lasting humbleness inside. 
When I started in College at Liceo de Masbate, I had these doubts about my tuition and any other school financial obligations, honestly I'd been into this mindset, that if I can't make it to be on the grantee's list, I will sacrifice to continue my college days in a school where there's less financial responsibilities. Yet, our school has the greatest heartfelt service to the poor and less fortunate students, they really actively working, just to include every students in the TES grantee's lists. Luckily, I was part of the said lists, and that was the moment that I had thrown my doubts and uncertainties away. My TES story would not be so interesting as others, but you have the assurance that I have been sharp in terms of spending those bill currency. As we are one of the PHEI's, every students who still have financial balances would have automatic deduction on their bills. In my case, our school deducted my whole first year balance, then I got disbursed  about half of the financial assistance. I was once planning to buy a laptop, but beacuse of the pandemic, I favored myself to buy only what I need in this time of health crisis, I only bought cellphone for my online classes. That was a great honor for me to be on the lists, I was overwhelmed seeing my college days possible because of this help. I hope that this one will continue!!
My heartfelt gratitude to LICEO DE MASBATE coordinators, who has been working for this, you guys never failed us students in making our dreams alive in moral and financial side. I also want to extend this gratitude to CHED who initiates these R.A. No. 10687 and R.A. No. 10391, thank you so much for this program. And above all, I am raising my hands to our Almighty Father for this grace. This is Jojie Ursabia Piasan, currently taking Bachelor of Secondary Education Major in English at Liceo De Masbate, telling you all "No one has ever become poor by giving". God bless us all❤️

"PAG MAY TINANIM MAY AANIHIN"

Ako yong isang batang hirap na hirap sa buhay, makakain man pero kailangan mo pang umarangkada at mag-handa upang mag banat ng buto para lamang maitawid ang gutom ng buong pamilya. Hindi man kami pinalad sa buhay ngunit puno kami sa pagmamahal. Bilang isang anak handa akong mag sakripisyo at magmalasakit sa magulang na tumanda sa kakatrabaho upang may ma ipakain sa anak.

Pangatlo ako sa pito naming magkakapatid, palyado ang ama kaya kinakailangang magsumikap upang may makain dahil ang dalawa kung nakakatandang kapatid lahat sila'y naghanap na ng kanya't kanyang pamilya at ako ang naging katuwang nang Ina sa paghahanapbuhay.

Salat man sa pera ngunit nagsusumikap sa pag-aaral, kaakibat man nito ang hirap basta't lumalaban may mararating. Ako nga pala si Gilbert Prieto, 27 taong gulang, at naka tira sa Barangay Kabalasan Baybay City, Leyte na nag sasabi sa katagang; "Kung Ika'y may itinatanim balang araw ika'y may aanihin."

At ako'y lubos na nagagalak nang nalaman kong isa ako sa pasok sa programa ng gobyerno na Tertiary Education Subsidy. Malaking tulong ang programang ito para sa tulad kong hirap sa buhay na halos hindi makapag-aral dahil sa kakulangang pinansyal.

Kaya ako ay nag PAPASALAMAT NG LUBOS sa lahat na sumusuporta sa aming mga naghihikahos upang makapag-aral at makapag-tapos.

LABAN PARA SA KALAMPUSAN!

Magandang araw po sa inyong lahat! Kaming tatlong magkapatid ay nakasali sa scholar na ito at laking pasasalamat namin na kami ay napili at laking biyaya ito na bigay ng Panginoon at sa aming pamilya.

Lima po kaming magkakapatid na parehong mga babae at kasalukuyang nag-aaral. Ang trabaho ng aming tatay ay isang magsasaka lamang at ang nanay naman namin ay nasa bahay lamang dahil siya ay may sakit na "stroke".

Alam nating lahat na pagdating sa pandemya napakahirap ang pamumuhay at sitwasyon ng mga tao lalong- lalo na ang mahihirap kagaya namin. Oo, napakahirap ng buhay kasi ang tatay lang namin ang nagsuporta sa aming makakain araw-araw , sa pag-aaral at mga gamot ng aming nanay. Kapag walang pasok, kami po ay tumutulong sa aming bukid kagaya ng paghahakot at pagtatanim ng mga produkto kagaya ng mga saging, lubi, karlang at iba pa at ititinda namin ito sa mercado ng Ormoc City. Madaling araw kaming pumunta sa mercado para itinda ang aming nakuhang produkto. Kahit kami ay simpling babae lang, kinaya namin ang trabahong panilalaki kasi wala kaming lalaking kapatid at palagi naming tinulungan ang aming tatay. Minsan, ginabi kaming naghahakot ng mga produkto pagkatapos ng klasi namin at gumamit lamang kami ng flashlight. Umulan man o uminit, ito'y hindi hadlang na kami ay nagpupursigi sa pag tatrabaho at pagtulong sa aming tatay kahit kaming lahat ay may mga klasi.

Kung hindi po kami nakasali sa scholar na ito, may posibilidad na may isa sa amin na makahinto ng pag aaral upang magtrabaho para maka suporta sa mga gastosin lalong-lalo na ang mga gamot ng aming nanay dahil kulang lang ang kinita namin araw-araw. Laking papasalamat namin na hindi lang isa sa amin ang napili kundi kaming TATLONG magkapatid ang napili at natulungan sa scholar na ito kahit magkaiba ang aming kurso at paaralan.

May youtube channel po kaming ginawa para maibahagi namin ang aming trabaho kong saan binavlog namin ang aming ginagawa sa aming bukid o farm

APPRECIATION POST FOR CHEDRO VIII

My heart can no longer contain the profound gratitude toward all the compassionate CHEDRO VIII staff. I am deeply grateful for all the assitance and opportunity provided by this office, particularly for providing me a free ticket to a collegiate education ride.

Way back in highschool, I was terrified of entering college because I was worried about the demands, especially on finances, given the fact that I am the eldest child in a brood of five and hail from a poor family. But, I remained steadfast in my desire to improve my family's situation. So, when I learned the news that I had been selected for the TES Scholarship Program, my world was suddenly lighted. I made a promise to myself that I would not waste this only chance I got to have a promising future.

Incredibly, scholarship is not just an educational grant; it is many things. From my perspective, it was HOPE because it made me want to believe that the comfortable life I imagined as a child could possibly be true. It was HAPPINESS because it allowed me to truly appreciate the fulfillment of being able to provide for my own school needs without bothering my family. Additionally, it was an EXISTENTIAL BOOSTER because it clarified my goal, which is to strive for excellence and be an asset to the country. For all these things I've been able to obtain because of the scholarship, I'm out of words to thank you enough.

Thank you so much, Ma'am Babie Jaromay DE Guia for the unending support as much as the sacrifices you've done for the TES Grantees of ESSU Can-avid and also to CHEDRO VIII fam, as a whole. I will always feel greatly indebted to the office for putting its shoulder to the wheel and bridged us to a brighter future. May you continue to fulfill the dreams of "poor-but-deserving" Filipino youths. I will always be proud to be a PINASkolar!

ALYSSA DOCENA BAGAPORO
Bachelor of Science in Agriculture
Eastern Samar State University Can-avid Campus
CUM LAUDE
Class of 2021
TES Grantee 2019-2021 ❤

Para talaga nating Tatay si PRRD. Sabi nga nila, edukasyon ang maipapamana sa atin ng ating mga magulang at ramdam natin ang pagmamahal ni PRRD sa ating mga kabataan sa pamamagitan nitong free and quality tertiary education. 

Maswerte ang mga estudyante ngayon. Hindi tulad namen na nag-aapply pa ng scholarships para lang makatulong sa magulang na makabawas sa bayarin sa school. Kaya sana naman mapahalagahan ito ng kasalukuyan at mga susunod pang henerasyon.

AND BE MENTORED BY SOME OF THE COUNTRY’S BEST FILMMAKERS AND
TOP CONTENT CREATORS.
☑️ DECEMBER 5, 2021
For Mindanao PINASkolars in PRIVATE HEIs
Click the link below ⬇️ to register:
https://bit.ly/Dec5Registration
CHED and UniFAST, in partnership with the Film Development Council of the Philippines (FDCP) Film School, launched the #MyKwentongCHEDUniFAST series of webinars for students who aspire to become digital content creators.
Exclusive to student beneficiaries of the Free Higher Education (FHE), Tertiary Education Subsidy and Tulong Dunong Program (TES-TDP)programs under RA 10931 or the Universal Access to Quality Tertiary Education Act, the #MyKwentongCHEDUniFAST webinars will be spread throughout the months of November and December. Participants who will be able to complete the whole course may claim a certificate signed by CHED, UniFAST, and FDCP.
Don’t miss the opportunity!

My height stop Sugod sa 1 year old us in wala pa nag 2. so meaning Baby height jud ko. Lima akong manghud then Yes agkaapsan ko nila hahaha hangtod sa naa na koy pang umangkon naanad na ko🤣. hapit na ko maapsan. Let me share my story. Elementary days (grade 1) Grabe ka caring and loving. Never ko na bully kay Gwapa gud ko 🤣. wala ko na bully sa uban pero gipa squat ko saakong teachers ( grade 1) kinsa bay dili masuko nga ingani na gani akong kahimtang gipasquat pa ko. Number 1 nasuko syempre ako mama ug papa. then na utro pa sa Grade 6 wal ko kadala ug libro maong gipa squat ko. ( let me remind you galisod kog dala saakong bag unsa nalang kaha nga naay libro. Gusto mo makita ko ninyo nga gaguyod sa bag padulong uli) Lisod kaayo ako kahimtang pero yes nag squat ko kay mao man ang consequence. Pag uli na ko sa balay niingun ko ni mama ( ma dili sa lang kog skwela kay sakit akoa tiil) niingun si mama ( naunsa man diay ka?) wala ko nitug.an pero kay gipugos man kog ayo ni mama, nitugan ko niya nga gipasquat ko. Abi na ko ako ray nasakitan pero makita bitaw nimo imong mama nga nagtalikod daw nagpahid sa luha sakit kaayo. Giadtoan ni mama among teacher. Highschool days Okay kaayo smooth ra kaayo akong life walY bully. Gaapil apil na kog singing contest adto ko murag na sikat ( chariz ra pero bugok gyapon ko) Love ko saakong family, love ko sa mga teacher, love ko saakong mga classmate. every singing contest buo gyud akong pamilya present sila tanan ( ingana sila ka proud saakoa maski si ate nag boardinghouse sa mambajao ulian ra ko niya para makakita sya) Akong graduation sa highschool present na pud sila tanan maski akong duha ka lola naa. College days first course Agriculture. Nakaya na ko ug tanom sa humay maski taga liog na na ko hahahah🤣 na enjoy ko saakong course. But ani na nagsugod ang tanan sa college ko nakaagbat ug bully. na stress ko ato grabe ka hadlok ako gibati. niabot mi sa point nga magpa blotter. Ako pa ang gipabaranggay. First time to na ko na guidance pa mi🥺. Grabe ka stress gyud to. Okay akong life gyapon sa agriculture life na ko. Ang mga Instructors ug mga classmate na ko okay kaayo. love ko nila. Second course kay nibalhin ko kay aglisod ko sa agriculture. Electronic technology Family gyapon ilang pag treat saakoa sa tanan instructors ug saakong mga classmate and all. One day Naa koy classmate na bully na sad ko. ikatwice na nia nga nahitabo nga gi bully ko mao nalang ni akong e estorya. nagbaklay2x mi saakong manghud ug naa na siya natabo na mo ( hubog) .
Siya : Isang tanong Isang sagot.
me : unsa mana?
Siya : Nganong imong manghud gwapa ikaw dili?.
Nag away mi ani nga time. when acquaintance party begin nagkaon pa una niduol na siya saakoa ug nakainom again. giignan ko niya ( soft drink gusto ka) niingun kog ( dili naa man kristal ddto ouh hulat ra ko ). Giduolan man kaha ko daw giyabuhan sa soft drinks. nitulo ra akong luha pag duol saakong manghud nitug.an ko niya. Ug wala na ko damha chicks ug sexy ako manghud ato pero gipangita niya tong guy bisan asa kay nawala ra kalit. Nakita na nagkagubot na toa nabalaka na ang tanan. nakita ra siya ug wala siya nitug.an. So kay nagkagubot naman nakig uli na ko saakong manghud. before mi niuli nagbuhat pa mi ug report sa nahitabo. Basta ang katapusan ato na okay ra mi.
Dili sayon akong naagian pero pasalamat ra sad ko kay naa koy pamya naa akong mama ug papa andam mag sakripisyo. Mao ning gitawag nga
NAG KINDER NGA 2'10 ANG HEIGHT, NI GRADUATE SA COLLEGE NGA 2"10 GYAPON ANG HEIGHT. ♥️♥️

"With thousands of students who struggle financially, I am truly thankful and sincerely honored to have been selected as one of the TES beneficiaries. TES helped me attain an amazing education which I believe will lead me to a brighter future.

Your generosity has a greater impact not only to myself but also to my family. My parents are farmers and hardly deal with everyday finances so, sending me to college is a challenge. But with this assistance, it reduced some of their burdens. This opportunity also allowed me to focus more on my school work and not to worry so much on how I am going to pay for school.

I do believe this grant will continue to help more students finish their courses and achieve their dreams. In other ways, I hope one day I will also be able to help students reach their goal in higher education.

I thought I wasn’t able to reach my goals, but with this grant, I made it. Again, thank you for your thoughtful gift."

RAQUEL T. GABULAN
BACHELOR OF SECONDARY EDUCATION MAJOR IN ENGLISH
MOUNTAIN PROVINCE STATE POLYTECHNIC COLLEGE

"I have three older siblings who live in Manila. I grew up almost alone when both of my parents passed away. I kept thinking that this shouldn't let me stop studying. Losing my parents is hard and when I graduated from high school, I was hesitant to continue my studies in college. I would rather seek a job to support myself financially. I tried to be determined and strong when I chose to study instead. I worked to support my studies and my daily expenses.

I am very grateful for the blessing that God gave me when I became one of the grantees of the Tertiary Education Subsidy (TES). It supported my studies and was able to buy a laptop when I was in 1st-year college. I graduated with the great help of TES. I hope that this can help more students, especially those who are orphaned wanting to graduate college and achieve their dreams."

Alexis Mosote
Iloilo Science and Technology University - Miagao
BS in Information Technology, Cum Laude

I would like to thank my alma mater Liceo de Masbate - LdeM Liceo de Masbate Registrar's Officefor giving this opportunity to all students to be part of unifast ,this blessing we received will never be forgotten till the rest of our lives♥️

"PAGSUBOK AY LABANAN UPANG PROBLEMA'Y MALAMPASAN"

We all know that studying in college is not easy for a poor person, especially a student like me that only have a mother who supported my study, because my father died when I was four years old. But I think if you try to work hard things will not be as hard as you think. I didn't expect to being one of the TES grantees. That time I have felt very lucky. I am very grateful to the TES for this opportunity. Especially to God, I'm thankful by having this. During pandemic, I really need money for my thyroid ultrasound, because there's a problem on my neck. Because of God's mercy my lucky came, which I could claim my scholar. It was a big help for my Thyroid ultrasound, laboratories and for the medicines I need to take 3times a day. Those time my mother wanted me to stop my study for the sake of my health, but I didn't agree. Through the help of TES, It's made me realize that I should continue my study whatever happen. I've always prayed to God for giving me strength and good health. The other times that I received my TES scholar, I gave it to my mother, but she gave it back to me and said"Use this money to buy things you need in your studies". So I used it, I bought a laptop because I thought it was the thing I really need to. Without TES, I could not have this gadget. My mother and I was very grateful for the blessings we received. I know that there are more students like me who need this opportunity, I hope that they will be part of the TES grantees. To my fellow students, I know that we are in a hard situation but even how hard the situation we have encountered or we may face, let us never stop pursuing our dreams. We should trust God for everything. This is Rosalie S. Morales, BEED students third year at Visayas State University Villaba-Campus. God bless us all and keep safe everyone.

One Last Sem nalang 🤞🤩🥰
I am a TES Grantee and this is my one last sem. I am very thankful to be one of the grantees. It really helps me a lot to overcome all the challenges of college journey. Without the TES Surely it is a rough road to overcome but because of this grant it feels that I am walking in a right path with good decision and guidance. Being a student in this new normal is both a challenge and a responsibility. It made me decide to continue or to stop. My TES grant change me a lot and help me to overcome such problems, they taught me a lot life learning lesson that I can use in my future. Have you ever think if without this grant if we can continue our studies?
When I was in my high school days, I always instill in my mind to find a work after my SHS life. But what make me change my mind to pursue my studies in Higher education, it is the poverty that arise in our country and most of the reason is the lack of education to young minds like me. Yes, other can say that education is not that needed but for me, education is the key tool to success. When TES came into my life, I totally say that this change my life in an instant, I know that with TES I can assure that my tertiary education is safe. I just remembered those days that during my face to face experience, I’d encountered a problem of not to go to school because I don’t have the money for fare, I am afraid of failing since I cannot comply some because I don’t have the resources to sustain my studies. But because of TES, you change that instinct.
This new normal challenge is both honor and responsibility for the students out there. It is not only giving me the idea of succession to my dreams but it is a plus points of a student who is struggling for the battle of dreams and studies. I am more thankful to the almighty father of giving me the guidance and sending me the TES grant so that I will be more energize to continue and strive more for my dreams in life. Together let’s make things happen.
Special thanks to Onefine Pictures ❤️ for the amazing shot 📸

❗️ ❗️ ❗️ 𝐀𝐍𝐍𝐎𝐔𝐍𝐂𝐄𝐌𝐄𝐍𝐓❗️ ❗️ ❗️ 
Who?       TES Batch 1
What?      Release of Tertiary Education Subsidy for 1st Semester, AY 2022-2023
When?     January 31, 2023
                 9:00 - 11:00 AM only
Where?    CSPC Cashier’s Office
STEPS TO FOLLOW IN CLAIMING THE SUBSIDY
✅STEP 1. Visit the Student Affairs and Services Office (SASO)
 A. Personal (Bring the original copy and photocopy of the documents)
 1. Present your school ID
 2. Fill out the Subsidy Claim Form (SCF)
 3. Submit six (6) photocopies of Student school ID with signature (long bond paper and have to be in color)
 B.  Representative/Authorized person:
 1. Present valid ID of the representative/authorized person  (Photocopy 4 copies)
 2. Actual ID of the Student-grantee
 3. Photocopy of Student school ID with signature (long size-colored, 6  copies)
 4. Authorization letter duly signed by the grantee (4 copies - long size)
5. ID of the authorized representative and 4 photocopies of ID of the claimant (long size-colored)
 6. Fill out the Subsidy Claim Form (SCF)
✅STEP 2. Proceed to the Cashier’s office
 A. Present the duly signed Subsidy Form to Cashier (SCF)
 B. Cashier releases the amount due you and  signs on the space provided in the Form
 C. After receiving the amount, beneficiary/authorized 
representative signs the payroll.
✅STEP 3.  Return to Student Affairs and Services Office (SASO)
 A. Submit the Subsidy Claim Form (SCF)
 B. Keep your own copy and go home safely.
❗️Observe proper health protocol❗️
✅Wear face mask when you go to CSPC✅
Thank you.

Tumutok sa ating facebook live, makibalita at maaaring ikaw ang isa sa mga masusuwerteng mananalo ng ating exclusive PiliPinaSkolar Kits o P1,000.00 worth of cellphone load pang online classes!

Simple lang! Para makasali:

- Mag-member ka ng ating PinaSkolar Groups
- I-like ang PILIPinaSkolar Halalan page at ang Prof Popoy page
(PiliPinaSkolar Halalan 2022)
(https://www.facebook.com/DeVeraPopoy)
- I-share ang ating facebook live for today.
- Sagutin ang tanong "Bilang isang studyante, anu-ano sa mga problema ng bansa ang sa tingin nyo ay dapat unang solusyonan ng susunod na maihahalal?"
- I-tag ang tatlong kaklase kasama ang inyong sagot sa comments section o sa Facebook Live

Kitakits!

PROUD WORKING STUDENT, PROUD TES GRANTEES

Bata pa lamang ako ay maaga ng namulat ang aking isipan sa kung gaano kahirap ang buhay. Kaya naman, sa murang edad ay pinasok kona ang pagiging Isang working student. Nagtapos ako ng Elementary bilang Isang working student at ganoon nadin sa Highschool hanggang sa Senior high. Ang pagiging working student lang kasi ang nakikita kung paraan para matulungan ang aking mga magulang sa kahirapan at kahit papaano ay maibsan ang kanilang responsibilidad sa aming walong magkakapakatid. Ngunit ng dumating na ako sa kolehiyo ay medyo nahirapan na akong pagsabayin ang aking pag-aaral at pagtatrabaho dagdag pa nito ang mga responsibilidad bilang isang mag-aaral at mga pasanin sa buhay. Iniisip ko kung paano makakatulong sa aking Pamilya habang nag-aaral at nagtatrabaho kaya naman nung napili ako bilang Isang TES GRANTEES sa aming paaralan ay naibsan ang aking problema lalong- lalo na sa panahon ng pandemya. Hindi lamang ang aking mga kinakailangan sa pag-aaral ang natulungan ng TES kahit paano ay natulungan din nito ang pangangailangan ng aking Pamilya. Sa ngayon, ay Isa na akong 4th year student at konting kembot nalang ay matatamasa kona ang inaasam na tagumpay bilang Isang working student at proud TES GRANTEES. Lagi lang nating tandaan na magsumikap at lumaban sa buhay. Lahat tayo ay nakakaranas ng kahirapan sa buhay kaya naman nasa sa atin nayon kung paano natin ito lalaban. Isaisip din natin na may mga tao na handang magbukas ng kanilang pinto para makamit natin ang ating inaasam na tagumpay.Maraming Salamat!

ANNALY M. CLEMENTE
BACHELOR OF SECONDARY EDUCATION-FILIPINO
SOUTHERN LEYTE STATE UNIVERSITY- SAN JUAN CAMPUS✨

Forever thankful♥️🙏 Thank you TES♥️

** REGION I, VIII, and XI from February 23-25 and February 28 - March 4, 2022 **

We are once again opening the LANDBANK Mastercard Prepaid Card (LMPC) Portal https://www.unifast.gov.ph/tes.lbp.app/ to all TES grantees who missed applying on their previous regional schedule! Please keep yourself posted on the succeeding schedules. Thank you!
To know more about the #LANDBANKTESCard and how to apply, visit our website https://unifast.gov.ph/video.php or watch it on our YouTube channel UniFAST Official https://youtu.be/H5Fs_9gRg7c / https://youtu.be/tDo2AdkAQ20
Please read our important reminders on the LMPC Application:
1. The 2x2 photo, front ID and back ID images for uploading must only be in JPG/JPEG format under 2MB file size or it will cause an error on PDF generation.
2. Special characters like dash (-) and dot (.) are not allowed. Ñ/ñ in names should be typed as N/n. Double check the pre-filled names for any correction.
3. Extension names should be in the First Name field (Example: Juan Jr.)
4. Leave the field blank if there is no Middle Name.
5. Type "N/A" if there is no Tax Identification Number (TIN).
6. A ZIP code is automatically generated based on the selected province and city, except for Metro Manila that you have to input manually. Double check if the generated ZIP code is correct.
7. For mobile numbers, input the last 10 digits only. (Example: 9187481035)
8. An email address with a dash is not acceptable. Use another valid email address.
9. Click Save then Finalize to generate the application form in PDF format. By clicking the Finalize button, editing is no longer allowed.
10. The HEI focals must make sure that the log-in credential used by the grantee matches the TES Award Number assigned to the grantee, and review the"Finalized" application for submission but may"Unfinalized" it for editing when a wrong input is found.
11. View the form by clicking the word "Here" in the upper part of the page.
12. Grantees will be informed through the portal if their application is being processed by UniFAST and LANDBANK, approved, rejected or if the LMPC is ready to be claimed. For a rejected application, a Remark found by LANDBANK appears in the upper part of the page and the fields in the portal are enabled again for editing.
13. For LMPC applications with"Exported" status but needing a correction, the TES grantee or HEI should send a signed letter to email address unifast_teslmpc@ched.gov.ph requesting to change any information provided. Please address it to the UniFAST OIC Executive Director, Atty. Ryan L. Estevez, and indicate the TES Award Number, Full Name and details to be corrected. The UniFAST ICT Unit will update its records and forward the request to LANDBANK for their action.
14. For grantees having problems logging in on the LANDBANK Mastercard Integrated Cardholder's Portal, directly contact LBP's customer service numbers below:
NCR: (+632) 8 405 7000
Outside NCR: 1 800 10 405 7000

Long Post Ahead!

Last 2018, I passed the NAT(NORSU Achievement Test) and was given the opportunity to take up my college degree at NORSU. I was priveledged enough to be one of those people who were given a chance to take their education at a Free Tuition University.

I lived a very unfortunate life. Papa nako is a construction worker and si Mama kay Housewife. I have 7 siblings and I am the youngest. So, it wasn't easy gyud. Still, I strived hard so that I can achieve my goals for me and my family.

When the Pandemic happened, our money was not enough to support my education that's why I chose to find a job and got hired at Lee Super Plaza. Working while studying requires a lot of time management, perseverance, determination and self motivation. That experience wasn't easy but I made through it.

I just want express my gratitude to CHED TES Unifast. Being one of your scholar since 2018 is a big blessing for me and my family. Also, I am grateful for the help and assistance of Norsu Scholarshipoffice Norsumain . Thank you both for the support and for giving me endless opportunities.

I am posting this because I want to have an awakening to those students who are struggling financially and have lost their hope. I want to say na don't lose hope and naay solution Ang tanan. Don't give up on your dreams or your dreams will give up on you. Keep on fighting and keep on believing in yourself.
#CHEDPINASKOLAR

Thank you TES,CHED and UNIFAST for the undying flame of Love👐💕

Good Day everyone, I am Erika Resquicio Cañadilla. A TES grantee of Eastern Visayas State University (Carigara Campus) from Brgy. Camansi Carigara Leyte. I'm the eldest daughter of a farmer and a housewife. Growing up in a poor and indigent family is kinda hard for me as an individual and as a student. As the eldest daughter in our family, it is my responsibility to study hard and to get a job in the future to help my parents but it will take a challenging and a backbreaking way and TES allowance helps me a lot. At first, I didn't expect that I will be included in this government program because there are many students who wants to be a TES beneficiary and being one of the chosen is a God's blessing to me. I've been praying to be one of the grantee because our family is not financially stable and it's a windfall for me and to my family. I am a 3rd year BSED-Sci student and I received my first allowance last month for the 1st semester and it helps me a lot. Studying amidst the pandemic is a challenge to me, I need to be wise in every decision that I will make, I'd faced many difficulties because I lack many material things to be used in this new normal in education. The first allowance that I received served as an anodyne to me because I did bought the things that I need to study. I bought some school stuff like study table, supply of papers(bond paper, construction paper, yellow paper etc.) Pens, pocket wifi and many others. Without the TES allowance, I wouldn't be able to catch up well in our lessons.there is no success without hardship -Sophocles. Achieving my dream and attaining success means that I will undergo so many trial and hardships and TES PINASKOLAR is one of my helper to lessen the adversity on the road to my great future. It's really true that no matter how hard you're situation is, there will always be someone who will help you to surpass your asperity and TES PINASKOLAR is one of God's blessings to me🥰 thank you so much TES❤️ I am so very proud to be a TES scholar and I know that this thank you of mine will not be enough to payback the goodness of the people behind this program. But I know that God will be the one to payback your goodness and I will always include all of you in my prayers.
#CHEDUniFAST
#TESTESTIMONY
#PROUDTESGRANTEE

CHED StuFAPs Region V congratulates Mr. Christian I. Lamud of the University of Saint Anthony- Iriga City, for placing second during the National Level of the selection of the "CHED StuFAPs Scholar Award: My Success Story" Video Contest.

Mr. Lamud placed first during the Regional Level of the competition held last July 29, 2021, at CHED V's Regional Office via Zoom.

CHED StuFAPs Region V is proud to share the winning entry and the remarkable journey of Mr. Lamud with high hopes to inspire and encourage students to dream and achieve their goals in life. He is currently the Human Resource Development Officer & Assistant to the VP for Academic Affairs of the University of Saint Anthony-Iriga City, his Alma Mater.

The awarding of the National Level winners will be held on February 10, 2022, during the "Padyak Parangal Para Sa Mga CHED Iskolars" at the CHED Central Office via Zoom.

I am thankful to be part of TES Guarantee in Pinaskolar in Region VIII.
Sobrang malaking tulong po ito hindi lamang sakin kundi pati na rin sa aming pamilya. Dahil dito ay nabili ko ang aking mga pangangailangan para sa aking pag-aaral. Lalo na ngayong Covid Pandemic at kailangan ko ng gadgets para sa online class, nakabili ako ng Laptop at Cellphone na magagamit ko at ng aking mga Kapatid. At kung noon ay kailangan ko pang umakayat sa aming bubong para lang makasagap ng signal ngayon ay nakabili ako ng wifi na sobrang nagpagaan para sa aking online class. Sobrang nagpapasalamat po ako at ang aking Pamilya sa Ched at sana'y mas marami pa kayong matulongan na katulad kong mag-aaral. God bless and more powers.

"Pangarap na Edukasyon Nahuli Man , ngayon Patuloy na Kinakamit dahil sa TES"
"Hindi Hadlang ang Kahirapan sa Taong May Pagpupursige at Tiyaga Sa Buhay"
Hi Everyone ☺️🙏lalo na Sa mga taong minsang sumuko sa pag aaral dahil sa kahirapan.Isa ako sa mga estudyanteng minsang nwalan ng pag asa sa buhay, minsang nwalan ng pag asang makatuntong sa kolehiyo dahil sa kakulangan  sa tulong pinansiyal , 
❣︎Taong 2015 ,Sa murang edad Lumuwas ako sa Manila upang Magtrabaho , Sa Ilang taong pagtatrabaho ko na wla pang natapos na kurso marami akong realisasyon at isa na doon ang " Ang Swerte ng mga taong nakakapagtapos Ng Kolehiyo"  
❤︎2016 to 2018 nagpokus ako sa pagtatrabaho , tumulong sa mga magulang at kapatid ko pero ni minsan hindi nawawala sakin ang pangarap ko ba makatapos ng College🙏💪
❣︎Year 2018 After all the Working  Years I decided to pursue my College Life  , dito ko pinagpatuloy ang Pangarap ko,  nagdesisyon akong mag enrol sa Eastern Samar Estate  University at labis ang aking pagkatuwa ng ako ay ma qualified sa isa sa mga pangarap kong Scholarship. First year college halos ndi pa nakakapag adjust ang aking mga magulang para sa pang araw araw kong pamasahe, pang gastos at kung ano ano pa. Dahil nga sa anim kaming nag aaral ndi maikakaila na baon sa utang ang aking mga magulang. 
❣︎Year 2019 Gumawa ako ng paraan upang matustusan ang aking pangangailangan.  Sa taong ito naging matatag akong Lakbayin ang Pagiging Working Student ,Naging  Frontrow Member ako ,Online Seller, Tagabenta ng mga Damit, Sabon ,Downy at kung ano ano pa, naging Bahagi din ako ng Avon, naging Dealer ako para makakuha ng komisyon hanggang sa Naawa na yung Panginoon at isa ako sa mga mapapalang nakapasok sa TES noong Second Year college naku. 
Sa Bawat  release of my TES Scholarship may naipupundar ako para sa Sarili ko upang makatulong sa pag aaral ko kabilang na rito ang Laptop , Cellphone at Second Hand na Motor na pinakamahalaga sa Pang araw araw na Biyahe ko  At hindi naman ako nabigo, nabili ko ito ng walang pag aalinlangan. Hindi ko ikinakahiya na ang aking mga magulang ay Farmer , bagkus ipinagmamalaki ko ito dahil sa bawat paang nababaon sa putik bagong hamon ito pamilya namin upang patuloy na mangarap.At naway maging inspirasyon din ang kwento ko sa mga taong minsang sumuko💪🙏
 Maraming salamat TES.Maraming Salamat ChedPinaskolar sa Pagpapatuloy sa naudlot kong Pangarap Sa Buhay🙏
Mary Joyce Contado Tapay
Eastern Samar State University
 Can Avid Campus
Bachelor of Science and Business Administration
Major in Financial Management

PANOORIN: Laging Handa Dokyu 4.0 - Ang Pamana: Ligtas na Balik Eskwela
Isa ang edukasyon sa mga sektor na labis naapektuhan ng pandemya kung saan maraming paaralan ang nagsara at ang mga estudyante ay napilitang umangkop sa makabagong paraan ng pag-aaral.
Nasubok man ang pasensya at determinasyon ng mga guro, mag-aaral, at maging ng kanilang mga magulang, hindi ito naging hadlang para ipagpatuloy ang pagkatuto ng mga kabataan.
Inihahandog ng Presidential Communications Operations Office - Office of the Global Media and Public Affairs, ang dokyu tungkol sa muling pagbubukas ng mga paaralan para sa face-to-face classes at ang pagsisikap ng gobyerno na masigurong ligtas ang pagbabalik-eskwela.
Ito po ang totoong kwento.

Oprah Winfrey once said,"Create the highest, grandest vision possible for your life because you become what you believe."
This quote is something I constantly remind myself and this has a big impact in my life.

Four years of hard work and determination has brought us here today, to this momentous occasion , which you and I and our dear family, looked forward to.
Despite the challenges that we have encountered during the pandemic, we are here today, gathered to commemorate our achievement as persevering students, to celebrate the hard work of our family. Parents, guardians and dear teachers, we are here today with great pride and honor that we are finally about to receive a degree which was once a dream but now is a reality because of YOU and because of this strong institution, The Iloilo Science and Technology University .

Let me tell you a little bit of my story. When I was in the primary school nahisa gid ko ya sa akon mga classmates kay may mga balon sila kag ako ya wala. At a young age, I woke up to the realities of life that I can't have what my classmates are enjoying because our family is struggling financially. I turned my insecurities into something that could help me and my family. I became MADISKARTE at an age where children like me are supposed to enjoy childhood. Kada Sabado kag Domingo ang mga kakanin nga naluto ni Lola, gina libud namon sang akon magulang sa mga kalye. Kon ma ubos na baligya, suhulan kami ni Lola kag amon ini gina supot para may gamiton sa pag escuela.

When I reached High School, nag doble pa gid ang akon paghimakas bangud gusto ko gid maka escuela kag makatapos. Masakit mabatian nga imo mismo kasilingan magsiling nga waay ka sang maabtan kay waay man kamo ikasarang sa pangabuhi.
Bisan ano pa kabudlay ang kabuhi, kulang ang galastuson, waay gid ako nag untat sa pag escuela kay gusto ko pamatud-an sa mga nag underestimate sa amon nga may maabot ako sa pila ka adlaw. Sa amo sadto nga edad, I learned how to ignore negative comments . I set my eyes to my dreams:to be a degree holder and help my family to live a much better life.

Year 2014 I graduated my High School then I took up 1 year vocational course here at WVCST now known as ISATU, kay wala ko kaabot sang entrance exam that time. I decided to enroll temporarily sa vocational course kay indi ko man gusto nga maulihi ako sa akon nga mga ka-batch.

After I graduated from my vocational course, I went to Manila and look for a job nga makabulig sa akon mga manghud nga maka escuela man.
I was only 17 that time, very young to be a breadwinner of a big family but I became one because life calls for me to be one.
Living in a place called an urban jungle, there were times nga gusto ko mag uli, makaupod ang akon pamilya. I long for them, I long for the comfort and the love from my parents and siblings, especially during those times I feel ill. Even if I want to, I cant.
My young self has to take all the challenges kay para sa akon, dapat maka bulig ko sa pamilya ko. I spent almost 2 years working in Manila then I decided to flew back here in Iloilo because Ive heard on the news about the UNIVERSAL ACCESS TO QUALITY TERTIARY EDUCATION ACT. (R.A. 10931) Para sa akon, chansa ko na ini maka escuela liwat nga wala na tuition kag bayad sang gobyerno ang akon pag escuela. Siling ko ma diskarte nalang ako dugang para sa akon pamilya samtang naga escuela kay indi pwede nga ako lang ma escuela kag mga utod ko indi.

I decided that I will take BSHM because I see it as a course that will open more opportunities for me in the future. After undergoing series of tests, both written and spoken, I was among the many hopefuls accepted in the HRT Department. BSHM is no joke because its costly. There are educational tours and practical assessments which calls for me to spend some money. I spent sleepless nights thinking how I can manage to pay all these? Although , I received some amount from CHED as I am a Tertiary Education Subsidy Program grantee , I still have financial worries because I'm a self-supporting student and a breadwinner of my family. Because from a very young age, I learned to be MADISKARTE, I applied as a student assistant. I was assigned as an SA or student assistant in the CIT Dean's office under the supervision of Dr. Celda.

As a student assistant, I've met many people along the way. One I couldn't forget is Dr. Susie, Asuncion Echaveria former OSAS Director. She was the one who saw potential in me. She encouraged me to participate in the affairs of the students because she said she sees me as a role model and a great leader. Like a real mother, Dr Echaveria motivated me and convinced me to run a higher position in the Student Republic . Para sa iya, isa ini ka pamaagi nga mas makita ko ang akon ikasarang kag good training ground ini para sa akon para sa maabot pa nga mga opportunities.

Dr Echaveria is right, in all the activities I joined here and outside the campus, na hanas gid ako bilang estudyante , student leader, bilang is aka young adult nga bisan daw kulang na oras ko kay naga SA pa ako, pero tanan fell on the right place. Looking back , kanami gid nga batyagon sa akon kaugalingon nga kasarang gale ako, bisan medyo kulang, at the end of the day, naga abot lang ang mga grasya nga para matabu ang mga bagay bagay.

I don't mean to brag, but I brought pride to myself , my family and our university because I'm a national awardee a few times , I sat as part of the search committee member for private sector representative in the board of regents upon the invitation of our strong President, Dr Raul Muyong and also I represented our school at the Junior Tourism Hospitality Management Association of the Philippines . I shared these recognitions to you because you are part of these. I couldn't do this alone without you all. You trusted me to lead you as a student leader, to represent our university many times and you journeyed with me to reach the place where we are now.

The journey wasn't easy, especially on my part as I have already mentioned to you my personal situation. Let me tell you, here's what I learned : The dreams and ambitions that we have, shaped us into what we are now and molded us on what we could become in the future, sadly, reaching our dreams and ambitions is not like riding an escalator, where we'll just wait until we get to the top.
There will always be trial and error in pursuing dreams and ambitions, don't be discourage because in every failure there is always success, as one of my closest friend would say"Going through college is like a video game, in every challenges and obstacles you went through are progress, and every year in your college years is a checkpoint and graduating is the reward by beating the last level", So keep trying and never give up because with every failed attempts are progress into reaching your dreams and ambitions.

For me, ISATU will always be my second-home. The people that I met here will always be my father, mother, sisters, and brothers because you are part of my laughter, my tears and my triumph. These experiences, taught me to be strong, determined, confident and grateful soul.
Before I close my speech allow me thank great people, I've met that influenced me and made a significant impact on my life. These people are closest to my heart and are my priceless treasure.

Ma, Pa, kami na lang nga mga kabataan niyo ang mabawi sa inyo despite, sa tanan nga pag-insulto kag pag-pakanubo sa inyo sang mga tawo, napakita ko sbung nga isa sa lima niyo nga mga bata nakatapos na sang iya nga pag-iskwela. Thank you for raising us nga may pinanilagan, mabinuligon, kag kung paano maging maayo sa isig-kapareho. To my four sisters and three nieces who became my inspiration and motivation to strive even more so that I could also help them in achieving what I have also achieved here today. Thank you, man sa akon nga mga katiyaan kag katiyuan, who are always supporting me in everything that I do in a good way and for not hesitating to provide in times I ask for help. To all of my closest cousins, who were my crying shoulders in times of my struggles. Thank you all for being there and listening to my constant rants.

To my wonderful and supportive friends who's always been there and supported not only during my college years but also during the trials and hardships that we've all shared together, Mishael, Lester, Jelyn, Herbert, John Azor, Berly John, Arly, Mae Pearl, Allen, Bonie, my working student colleagues, and to my SSC adviser and officers, NO amount of thank you's is enough to express on how grateful I am that you guys have been a part of my life but regardless, Thank you so much.
To all of my CIT family (lead by equally strong, Dr. Rene Celda and Maam Analie M. Celda .

This speech won't end without giving all the Glory and Honor to my Creator who never ever left me . When I was at my lowest, He lift me up. When I needed guidance, He brought me the right people. I am nothing without Him. My heart is full of gratitude.

To each one of you my fellow graduates, I congratulate you for standing strong all these time. May you remain strong for yourself, your family and for God.

CONGRATULATIONS!👏💪🎉

ROMAR A. LAGUNDAY
BACHELOR OF SCIENCE IN HOSPITALITY MANAGEMENT MAJOR IN CRUISE SHIP SERVICES
ILOILO SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY UNIVERSITY (Main Campus)

Maging kaming mga nag aaral sa pribadong institusyon ay abot ng liwanag na dulot ng Tertiary Education Subsidy, mayaman man sa paningin ng karamihan sapagkat nakakapag aral sa isang pang pribadong pamantasan subalit may iilang estudyante pa rin sa likod ng karangyaan ang nakagapos sa tanikala ng kahirapan.

#MyTestiomonial
#StoryOfHopeInTheMidstOfDarkness
Anak ng isang kargador na ama, anak ng inang maagang gumigising sa madaling araw upang makapag tinda, sa ganitong paraan lamang kami binubuhay ng aking mga butihing magulang. Apat kaming magkakapatid kaya't mahirap para sa kanila na matustusan ang aking pag aaral, lalo na at napilitan akong mag aral sa isang pribadong paaralan Saint Paul School of Professional Studies (SPSPS). Sinubukan ko namang mag enroll sa isang pampublikong pamantasan upang kahit papaano wala na akong babayaran tuition, sa kasawiang palad kinapus makakuha ng puwang sa kursong Bachelor of Science in Accountancy, noon pa man pinangarap kung maging CPA balang araw. Kaya't nakipag sapalaran akong ipaglaban ang aking pangarap sa isang pribadong paaralan, kahit na walang kasiguraduhan kung hanggang saan lang ang kakayanin ng isang kapus palad sa pinili niyang laban. Subalit isang semestre lang ang aking nakayanan napilitan din akong tumigil sa pag aaral sa kadahilanang kahit na matrikula hirap na hirap kaming mabayaran.

Napanghinaan ako ng loob at sumuko nalang, tinanggap ko sa sarili ko na kahit kailan man hindi na ako magiging isang Sertipikadong Pampublikong Taga Tuos ng bayan. Subalit sa gitna ng dilim may kung anong liwanag sa aking buhay ang dumating, lingid sa aking kaalaman na ako pala ay isa sa napiling iilan na maging benipisaryo ng Tertiary Education Subsidy. Abot langit ang aking pagkagalak sapagkat binuhay nito ang aking naghihingalong pangarap na balang araw maging isang Certified Public Accountant. Kaya't taus puso akong nagpapasalamat sa lahat ng bumubuo programang ito lalong lalo na sa butihin nating Pangulong Pres. Rodrigo Roa Duterte, Sa CHED sa pangunguna ni Commisioner Prof. Prospero De Vera III at sa UniFast. For about 2 more semester nalang ay matatapus ko na ang aking pag aaral sa kolehiyo. Mas pag susumikapan ko pang abutin ang napakalapit at abot kamay ko ng pangarap, nang balang araw kahit papaano ay matumbasan ko ang oppurtunidad na inyong ipinagkaloob sa isang estudyang nangarap na maging Certified Public Accountant.

Logene G. Ablay
Bachelor Of Science In Accountancy
Saint Paul School of Professional Studies

malaking tulong na yan sa mga estudyante natin.

"Ako ay isa sa naging benepisyaryo ng TDP-CHED Unifast Grant. Ako ay gumawa ng mensahe para maipakita ang lubos na pasasalamat kung paano nakatulong ang scholarship na ito financially, ito ang naging dahilan para ako ay grumaduate.

Galing ako sa mahirap na pamilya ngunit may paninindigan sa buhay. Hindi naging hadlang ang kahirapan para sumuko sa pangarap sa buhay. Sa sitwasyon naming naranasan, mas lalong nagpursigi at pinagbuti ko ang pag-aaral ko at mas nagkaroon ako ng tiwala sa sarili upang makamit ang mithiin sa buhay.

Hindi pa man ako nakatungtong sa kolehiyo, problemado na kami kung saan kukuha ng gastusin para matustusan ang aking pag-aaral lalo na't kabilang ang aking magulang sa Senior Citizen.

Hanggang sa isang araw, may nakapagsabi sa akin na kabilang ang pangalan ko sa listahan ng TDP- CHED Unifast. Kaya, ako ay lubos na nagpapasalamat dahil isa ako sa maswerteng napili na mabigyan ng scholarship sa programang TDP- CHED Unifast. Dahil dito, nabawasan ang problema ko sa pera. Natustusan nito ang mga gastusin ko sa pagkain, allowance, pamasahe at mga kagamitan sa aking pag-aaral. Sobrang salamat talaga sa opportunidad at tulong na naipagkaloob sa akin. Sa lahat ng bumubuo sa CHED-UNIFAST maraming maraming salamat po ! Sana ay madami pa kayong matulungan na mg mag-aaral para maabot din nila ang kanilang pangarap na makatapos. Godbless po palage !!

Ngayong taon 2022, nito lamang buwan ng Hulyo ika-14, ako ay nakapagtapos sa kursong BACHELOR OF ELEMENTARY EDUCATION- isang pangarap na natupad dahil sa TDP-CHED Unifast CAR. Sipag, tiyaga , tiwala sa sarili at scholarship ang dahilan kung bakit ko naabot ang pangarap ko at ng aking pamilya na makapagtapos sa kolehiyo."

ARLYN V. ARIMBUYOTAN
BACHELOR OF ELEMENTARY EDUCATION
APAYAO STATE COLLEGE- LUNA CAMPUS

Taos pusong pasasalamat po sa lahat ng mga taong bumubuo sa UNIFAST sa pagkakataong ibinigay saakin para maging isang grantee ng nasabing scholarship. The CHED-CAR UniFAST Unit has started collecting Certificates of Enrollment of enrolled beneficiaries under the Tertiary Education Subsidy (TES) Program and Tulong-Dunong Program (TDP-TES) for the First Semester of School Year 2022-2023.


In this regard, we remind the TES beneficiaries and TDP-TES grantees of their timely enrollment to avoid delays in the processing of their grants.

"I NEVER EXPECTED TO BE THE LUCKY ONE"

I will never forget that day, the day I saw my name on the lists of students for TES beneficiaries posted in our department's bulletin board in our school. Did you know that feeling na you're not expecting to be on the lists not to mention that it's the TES Scholarship, because in the first place I didn't applied for it? It's not that I don't like to be a TES Scholar but it's the other way around, I was really thankful and will always be. The time I firstly knew that I'm on the list and of course until today I always thanks God for giving me this kind of opportunity a blessing though. Also, thank you CHED-Unifast and to our TES focal person ma'am Analie Nicart for guiding us and helping us get our TES allowance.
We all knew especially us students, how this pandemic brought us in terms of access to online classes. That is why being a TES grantee is such a great blessing to me because through TES, I was able to buy gadgets that I can now use during our online classes and other school matters that really need the use of gadget. I'm glad to say that because of TES I have now my mobile phone and for the first time I made it to buy my first ever brand new TravelMate P2 ACER LAPTOP which is a very essential tool in doing school activities like this semester that we will be making our Thesis. TES is a huge help for us students who can't afford to buy such gadgets.
To my co-students who wishes to be a TES Scholar but never be that lucky, don't be disappointed if you'll not be chosen. Instead, study hard and your LUCK will just come your way in the time that you never expected to come just like what happened to me.

Gayda, Lea L.
Bachelor of Science in Hospitality Management
Eastern Samar State University
GUIUAN CAMPUS

TES Update #104

Miss us? #8pmHabit ÃƒÂ°Ã…Â¸Ã¢â‚¬Â¢Ã¢â‚¬" is Back! Here we go, Central Luzon cuties! 😍

An additional 912 continuing grantees in Central Luzon may now access their P30,000 1st Semester TES benefits in eleven (11) private higher education institutions after receiving P27.6 million funds from UniFAST through the CHED Regional Office III.

As of the latest report, the Regional Office has accomplished a 98.18% disbursement of 1st semester benefits to validated grantees in private HEIs. Simultaneously, other HEIs are highly encouraged to comply with the billing and liquidation requirements so that the remaining unpaid grantees may get their TES at the earliest time.

We still have more good news for you, cuties! Drop by at the official Facebook page of UniFAST every 8 o'clock p.m. so you won't miss the latest TES and TDP updates.

UniFAST OIC Executive Director Atty. Ryan Estevez, together with CHED and UniFAST Board Chairman J. Prospero 'Popoy' De Vera III, graced the symbolic turn-over ceremony of 17 private higher education institutions in Cotabato City to the Bangsamoro Autonomous Region in Muslim Mindanao (BARMM) Ministry of Basic, Higher and Technical Education on November 11, 2021 in Koronadal City.

MBHTE Minister Mohagher Iqbal accepted the plaque that symbolizes the transfer of authority and administration of these HEIs to MBHTE.

MBHTE Deputy Minister Haron Meling, Director General for Higher Education Marjuni Maddi, Director General Abdullah Salik Jr. and MBHTE Chief Legal Officer Mojahid Guro accompanied Minister Iqbal. Higher Education in the Context of Bangsamoro Organic Law (HECBOL) Project Director Maximo Aljibe, CHED Regional Office XII Director Nelia Alibin and presidents were also present during the ceremony.

Notre Dame University President, Fr. Francis Efren Zabala, and Jamiat Cotabato and Institute of Technology President Ustadz Saad Sindatok gave their messages as representatives for the following HEIs:
1. Academia de Technologia in Mindanao, Inc.
2. AMA Computer College-Cotabato Campus
3. Antonio R. Pacheco College, Inc.
4. Coland Systems Technology, Inc.
5. De La Vida College, Inc.
6. Dr. P. Ocampo Colleges, Inc.
7. Headstart College of Cotabato, Inc.
8. Jamiat Cotabato and Institute of Technology, Inc.
9. Kutawato Darussalam College
10. Mindanao Capitol Colleges, Inc.
11. Notre Dame Center for Catechesis, Inc.
12. Notre Dame Hospital and School of Midwifery
13. Notre Dame University
14. Notre Dame - RVM College of Cotabato
15. Shariff Kabunsuan College, Inc.
16. St. Benedict College of Cotabato, Inc.
17. STI College of Cotabato

In accordance with Article IX, Section 16 of RA 11054 or the Bangsamoro Organic Law:"Any school, college or university existing in the Bangsamoro Autonomous Region as of the effectivity of this Organic Law, and such other schools and institutions that may be established hereinafter shall be deemed integral components of the educational system of the Bangsamoro Autonomous Region, and shall be governed by their respective charters."

The Commission on Higher Education is pleased to inform interested parties of the call for applications to the Chevening Scholarships Program for Academic Year 2022-2023.

This year's call for new applicants follows the selection of 25 scholars from the Philippines who will be taking up their post-graduate degrees at UK universities this coming academic year.

Chevening Scholarships are the UK's government scholarship program, funded by the Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Office (FCDO) and partner organizations. The scholarship offers full financial support for future leaders to study any eligible master's degree at any UK university whilst also gaining access to a wide range of exclusive academic, professional, and cultural experiences. Successful applicants are required to return to their home countries after their year of study and stay for a minimum of two years.

Application documents must be submitted at www.chevening.org/apply on or before 02 November 2021.

Details on the eligibility criteria, scholarship specifications and application timeline may be accessed at https://www.chevening.org/scholarships/.

**LANDBANK TES CARD ADVISORY**

The LANDBANK Mastercard Prepaid Card #LMPC Portal is NOW OPEN to ALL REGIONS and to #TertiaryEducationSubsidy grantees who have not yet finalized their TES Card applications.

Click https://www.unifast.gov.ph/tes.lbp.app/

Take note of the following reminders:
1. The 2x2 photo, front ID, and back ID images for uploading must only be in JPG/JPEG format under 2MB file size. In case of an error in the PDF generation, use "Fileminimizer Pictures" or other similar third-party applications to compress images. After uploading, click save and re-finalize the application.
2. Special characters like dash (-) and dot (.) are not allowed. Ñ/ñ in names should be typed as N/n. Double-check the pre-filled names for any correction.
3. Extension names should be in the First Name field (Ex. Juan Jr.)
4. Leave the field blank if there is no Middle Name.
5. Type "N/A" if there is no Tax Identification Number (TIN).
6. A ZIP code is automatically generated based on the selected province and city, except for Metro Manila that you have to input manually. Double check if the generated ZIP code is correct.
7. For mobile numbers, input the last 10 digits only. (Example: 9187481035)
8. An email address with a dash is not acceptable. Use another valid email address.
9. Click Save then Finalize to generate the application form in PDF format. By clicking the Finalize button, editing is no longer allowed.
10. The HEI focals must make sure that the log-in credential used by the grantee matches the TES Award Number assigned to the grantee, and review the"Finalized" application for submission but may"Unfinalized" it for editing when a wrong input is found.
11. View the form by clicking the word "Here" in the upper part of the page.
12. Grantees will be informed through the portal if their application is being processed by UniFAST and LANDBANK, approved, rejected or if the LMPC is ready to be claimed. For a rejected application, a Remark found by LANDBANK appears in the upper part of the page and the fields in the portal are enabled again for editing.
13. For LMPC applications with"Exported" status but needing a correction, the TES grantee or HEI should send a signed letter to email address unifast_teslmpc@ched.gov.ph requesting to change any information provided. Please address it to the UniFAST OIC Executive Director, Atty. Ryan L. Estevez, and indicate the TES Award Number, Full Name and details to be corrected. The UniFAST ICT Unit will update its records and forward the request to LANDBANK for their action.
14. For grantees having problems logging in on the LANDBANK Mastercard Integrated Cardholder's Portal, directly contact LBP's customer service numbers below:
NCR: (+632) 8 405 7000
Outside NCR: 1 800 10 405 7000

Happening today!

NCMC TES grantees gathered together for AY 2022-2023 Orientation

NCMC TES grantees gathered together for AY 2022-2023 Orientation today , October 12, 2022 at NCMC Gymnasium, at 1' o clock this afternoon.

In her opening remarks, Maam Katherine Parto, the NCMC Scholarship Coordinator and TES Focal Person, inquired about their social, emotional, and psychological wellbeing and urged pastors to pray for the students.

The VP Finance, Ma'am Shemy Marie Salimbangon, encouraged the students to keep improving their grades, spread awareness of the program by expressing gratitude, and pray for the success of the TES program.

The students are proud to show their ATM cards as proof that they have received TES funding and are scholarship recipients.

Tertiary Education Subsidy (TES) is under Republic Act No. 10931 also known as 'Universal Access to Quality Tertiary Education Act" of 2017.
UniFAST, also known as Republic Act No. 10687, reconciles, improves, strengthens, expands, and puts under one body all government-funded modalities of Student Financial Assistance Programs (StuFAPs) for tertiary education, and special purpose education assistance, in both public and private institutions. The said modalities include scholarships, grants-in-aid, student loans , and other specialized forms of StuFAPs formulated by the UniFAST Board.

NEWS FEATURE: CHED-CAR UniFAST Successfully Kicks Off SEED Project Series
In its quest to champion accessible and relevant education services in the Cordillera, the  Commission on Higher Education - Cordillera Administrative Region (CHED-CAR) Unified Student Financial Assistance System for Tertiary Education (UniFAST) Unit successfully kicks off its learning and development project dubbed as the SEED (Skill Enhancement and Employee Development) Project on June 17, 2022. 
The first amongst the monthly series which is in celebration of the National Information and Communications Technology (ICT) Month is a webinar regarding the Philippine National Public Key Infrastructure (PNPKI). Experts from the Department of Information and Communications Technology (DICT) - CAR graced the event as the Resource Speakers. Ms. Laarni C. Cañero, Planning Officer II, presented the details regarding the PNPKI, whereas Ms. Mona Lisa V. Viscarra, Provincial Officer of DICT - Kalinga, demonstrated the online registration system of PNPKI. 
The resource speakers urged the participants to shift from electronic signature to digital certification to ensure the authenticity,  integrity non-repudiation, and confidentiality of their online transactions. Additionally, they informed the participants regarding the Public Key Infrastructure (PKI). PKI allows users of public networks like the Internet to exchange private data securely. Furthermore, PKI is essentially a set of hardware, software, policies, personnel and procedures needed to create, manage, distribute, use, store and revoke digital certificates. The PKI is one of the core services being offered by the DICT that will foster trust in the government by ensuring secure and reliable online transactions.
Government employees, agencies, and private individuals who wish to avail of the PKI being offered by the DICT can apply online at https://bit.ly/ApplyPNPKI. For more details regarding PNPKI, visit https://dict.gov.ph/pnpki/. 
A total of fifty-two participants attended the webinar which includes the employees of the Regional Office and UniFAST Focal Persons of various higher education institutions in the Region. 
The SEED Project is an initiative of the CHED-CAR UniFAST Unit under the leadership of Dr. Demetrio P. Anduyan Jr, Director IV, that aims to promote excellence in client service through the provision of learning and development programs for its employees and UniFAST Focal Persons from its partner HEIs in the Region. 
#chedCARes
#chedunifastcordillera
#PINASkolar
#SEEDProject

TES Update #66

Patuloy pa rin ang pagbuhos ng TES ngayong BER months sa Ilocos Region! 😊 

The UniFAST and CHED Regional Office I recently transferred P84.6 million funds to provide assistance to beneficiaries of the TES program in seven (7) private higher education institutions (PHEIs) in Region I. The additional release of funds will support 2,792 ongoing grantees through the disbursement of P30,000 each for the 1st semester.

Altogether, the CHEDRO I proudly reports that 59 PHEIs have already received their TES funds amounting to P312 million with which the regional office has efficiently distributed among 10,299 or 85.56% of their validated continuing grantees for the Academic Year 2020-2021.

Moreover, CHEDRO I is now expediting the release of TES for two (2) PHEIs while the other six (6) are just waiting for the release of funds from the Department of Budget and Management (DBM).

PROJECT MARiTES | A special module of the Youth Entrepreneurship Program (YEP) – Project MARiTES, Be Your Own Boss Boot Camp is conducted in Baguio City from July 12-14, 2022.
This is in accordance to the agreement among the Department of Trade and Industry Cordillera, Commission on Higher Education Cordillera, and State Universities and Colleges (SUCs) in CAR.
Among those who will benefit in the project are the 58 student-grantees of Tertiary Education Subsidy program chosen by the six SUCs in the region, namely Abra State Institute of Sciences and Technology, Apayao State College, Benguet State University, Ifugao State University, Kalinga State University, and Mountain Province State Polytechnic College. Joining them are 13 Baguio City YEP mentees.
Project MARiTES is a conceptualized series of training aiming to equip beneficiaries (grantees) the adequate knowledge and skills in entrepreneurship and business management. 
As a team, CHED-CAR Unified Student Financial Assistance System for Tertiary Education Unit will oversee the overall implementation of the conduct of the project while the DTI-CAR will provide trainers, experts, training courses, and modules needed for the project.

𝐒𝐈𝐈𝐓 𝐫𝐞𝐥𝐞𝐚𝐬𝐞𝐬 32 𝐌𝐢𝐥𝐥𝐢𝐨𝐧 𝐓𝐄𝐒 𝐠𝐫𝐚𝐧𝐭 𝐟𝐫𝐨𝐦 𝐂𝐇𝐄𝐃 𝐟𝐨𝐫 2𝐧𝐝 𝐬𝐞𝐦𝐞𝐬𝐭𝐞𝐫 𝐀.𝐘. 2021-2022
December 20, 2022 – Siargao Island Institute of Technology distributes Tertiary Education Subsidy (TES) to 529 students amounting to roughly 15 million pesos to complete the total of 1,079 grantees for the second semester of academic year 2021-2022 at SIIT ground. 
The distribution was attended by the school president, Atty. Francisco T. Matugas who personally monitored the efficient release and handed the subsidy to the grantees together with their parents. In his message, he thanked the Commission on Higher Education (CHED) and the national government for allotting slots to underprivileged but deserving Siargaonons who wish to obtain a college degree in the institution.
“Pamasalamaton gajud kita kan presidente Duterte sanan kan CHED Commissioner Popoy De Vera, kay waya kalimti an mga taga-SIIT na maka-avail nan TES. Pati na sab kan Ma'am Sol sanan kan Cong. Bingo sa pagsuporta sa ini na programa,” Pres. Matugas said.
SIITian grantees agree on the relevance of the subsidy in the time of COVID-19 pandemic and how it supports them 1 year from the onslaught of typhoon Odette. 
TES is a grant-aid program of the CHED under Republic Act 10931 or the Universal Access to Quality Tertiary Education Law (UniFAST) signed by President Rodrigo R. Duterte in 2017. This program aims to help disadvantage students to pursue their college degrees.

NEWS FEATURE: COS and JO Personnel Enhances Emceeing and Public Speaking Skills in SEED Special Episode

True to its quest to champion accessible and relevant education services in the Cordillera, the training-workshop on Emceeing and Public Speaking, a special episode of the SEED (Skill Enhancement and Employee Development) Project of the Commission on Higher Education - Cordillera Administrative Region (CHED-CAR) Unified Student Financial Assistance System for Tertiary Education (UniFAST) Unit, was successfully conducted on August 04, 2022.

The said workshop aimed to enhance the emceeing and public speaking skills of the employees of the Regional Office, specifically its Contract of Service and Job Order Personnel.

Mr. Kevin Jake M. Angyab of the University of Baguio Science High School served as the Resource Person. For eight hours, participants were trained on the rudiments of emceeing, public speaking as well as event facilitation.

Atty. Ryan L. Estevez, OIC - Executive Director of UniFAST, also graced the event by sending his message. In his message, he encouraged the participants to face their fears in public speaking as facing their fears will be the first step to improvement. Also, he noted that no one was born good in public speaking, including him, but through knowledge and practice, one can be a good public speaker.

The morning session of the workshop was an informative session by Mr. Angyab wherein he presented the technicalities needed in emceeing. He enthusiastically discussed the 3Ms of event facilitation namely: Matter, Method, and Manner.

In the afternoon, participants were grouped into three (3) for the workshop activity. As an output of the workshop, the groups were to come up and conduct a program. The workshop concluded with participants presenting their activity outputs and words of gratitude by Ms. Jezeny O. Laoyan, Project Technical Staff III of the UniFAST Unit.

The SEED Project is an initiative of the CHED-CAR UniFAST Unit under the leadership of Dr. Demetrio P. Anduyan Jr, Director IV, that aims to promote excellence in client service through the provision of learning and development programs for its employees and UniFAST Focal Persons from its partner HEIs in the Region.

Occidental Mindoro State College President Marlyn Nielo:
Occidental Mindoro State College expresses her utmost commitment and dedication to the implementation of flexible learning the new normal. It has become the priority not only of CHED, but of HEIs as well, to explore innovative learning modalities while ensuring the quality of education offered by the college. We recognize the continuity of learning even beyond the usual face-to-face instruction.

Palawan State University President Ramon Docto: Palawan State University re-echoes its strong commitment supporting Flexible Learning Modality (FLM), which has helped us ensure that learning continues despite disruption of face-to-face classes. We greatly owe our progress in the use of this modality to the unselfish and generous efforts of local and national leaders, the CHED and partner agencies, our faculty frontliners and students who adapted to the situation.

CHED Chief is Alingag, adopted son of Kalinga
Commission on Higher Education (CHED) Chairman Popoy De Vera was adopted as son of the Province of Kalinga and was dubbed as “Alingag” which means “to re-echo,” in recognition of his works and contributions in the Philippine higher education.
The adoption of De Vera, through SP Resolution No. 2022-046, was recently conferred by Provincial Governor Ferdinand B. Tubban in the presence of members of the Sangguniang Panlalawigan, Kalinga State University (KSU) President Eduardo T. Bagtang and other guests at KSU.
De Vera’s visit in Kalinga is part of his Padyak: Claiming Victory for Philippine Higher Education, wherein he travels across regions to report on the achievements of the Duterte administration on higher education. Part of the Padyak is to meet the Tertiary Education Subsidy (TES) grantees under Republic Act (RA) 10931 or the Free Higher Education (FHE) law and listen to their success stories.
To date, there are 40,195 student-beneficiaries of the FHE law in the Cordillera Administrative Region (CAR), including 4,177 students receiving the TES. In Kalinga province, 6,782 students no longer pay tuition and miscellaneous fees and 829 students get the P40,000-P60,000 TES per year in public and private colleges and universities.
“I am deeply honored and humbled by the recognition given to me by the Province of Kalinga through Governor Tubban. It is a recognition that makes me now commit to  continue implementing RA 10931 and to look for ways so more students in Kalinga can go to college. I also commit to assist KSU in its efforts to provide access to quality education to the  communities they serve,” De Vera said.
According to the resolution, being an adopted son of Kalinga is a time-honored tradition of the province and in consonance with customary indigenous ethnic practices and personages and is conferred to individuals who have singularly endeared themselves and contributed outstanding services to the people.
The resolution further stated that “De Vera serves as an academician whose technical expertise helped policy-makers for the passage of legislative measures in educational development and other public services.”
Sons and daughters of the province are granted certain privileges including protection under the auspices of the Kalinga Peace Pact institution of the Bodong Justice System through the Pagta, the law of the Bodong

February is National Arts Month!

UniFAST joins in the national celebration of Arts Month this February with the theme, "Ani ng Sining, Bunga ng Galing". It aims to immerse Filipinos in diverse cultural expressions and celebrate the bountiful harvest from the Filipino imagination. The theme"galing" refers to excellence in the arts as both a source of bounty despite challenging times and a product of the passion of Filipino artists and cultural workers. It also alludes to artistic excellence and underscores the arts' capacity to heal, rebuild, and restore in a post-pandemic setting.

By virtue of Presidential Proclamation No. 683 signed in 1991, the National Arts Month celebration is led by the National Commission for Culture and the Arts (NCCA). Check out https://ncca.gov.ph/ and https://www.facebook.com/NCCAOfficial for various face-to-face and online activities this February and March.

Watch out too for our upcoming ART CONTEST in celebration of the 3rd National Higher Education Day this May!

Meet and Greet with Chair Popoy and PADYAKwentuhan 2022
PADYAKarunungan 2022 features the PADYAKwentuhan: Kwentong MIMAtROPA with CHED Chair Popoy De Vera together with the selected Student Leaders of Marinduque State College (MSC) and selected TES Grantees of Marinduque Midwest College held last February 23, 2022 at MSC Gymnasium participated by hundreds of RA 10931 Beneficiaries, Concerned Officials, Faculty members and Staff from different Higher Education Institutions (HEIs) in the Island of Marinduque.
A rare opportunity for our MIMAROPA Students most especially our RA 10931 beneficiaries to have an exclusive audience with the CHED Chairman which included testimonies from TES beneficiaries. Some of the student grantees shared their journey and success stories as recipients of the Tertiary Education Subsidy program. They stand as an inspiration to their fellow grantees to dream big and strive harder for their future. 
A talk show style interview session concluded the activity with TES beneficiaries representing both private and public schools got the chance to pick the mind of the Chair. The student representatives’ concerns were generously answered by the Chair on topics ranging from future scholarship grants, conduct of face to face classes, status and release of TES grants and student activities post-pandemic.

JUST SO YOU KNOW

One more day before you cast your ballot. Here are some important reminders:

- Double check your precinct and familiarize yourself with the route. Voting hours will run from 6:00 AM to 7:00 PM on May 9, 2022. Expect long lines, so come in early to avoid hassle.
- Bring your own pen to sign the Election Day Computerized Voters Lists.
- Wear your face mask and bring alcohol. Voters are not obliged to wear a face shield (unless under Alert Level 4) or present a vaccination card or a negative COVID-19 test result.
- A Voter's ID is not a requirement to vote. But in case your identity is challenged, you may be asked to present any valid ID.
- Overvoting invalidates your vote so make a list. Don't forget to check the back of the ballot for the Party-List candidates.

PADYAKalikasan | Press Conference
A Press Conference with CHED Chairperson Dr. J. Prospero E. De Vera III, CHEDRO Director Atty. Joselito C. Alisuag, UniFAST Director Atty. Ryan L. Estevez, and Presidents of SUCs in MIMAROPA Region. 
The event was held right after the tree planting event, which concluded the PADYAKalikasan in the province of Romblon. Organized by the Romblon State University, with the participation of the local press in the region. The questions centered around the effectiveness of RA 10931 and CHED's action plan on promoting sports events on colleges and universities. The chairman shared how many students were granted the Tertiary Education Subsidy and his experience talking with TES beneficiaries on how it helped them financially allowing them to focus on studying and finishing their course.. Due to the RA 10931 alleviating the financial burden on families, more parents are encouraging their children to obtain a college degree and get better jobs. Chairperson De Vera also stated that CHED has started its part on promoting sports events 2 weeks ago when the CHED Friendship Games were launched.

Kabataang Iskolar ng Pilipinas, ang Pili ninyo ang kinabukasan ng ating bansa.

The Philippine 2022 National Elections is upon us; are you ready to use your vote as your voice?

Introducing PILI-PinaSkolar Halalan, your go-to online guide for your smart choice!

PILI-PinaSkolar Halalan is a platform aimed to educate the people particularly the higher education/youth sector, which comprises more than half of the voting population of the Philippines, in relation to the upcoming May 2022 Elections.

Our mission is to encourage youth to exercise the right to suffrage, expose disinterested information of the aspirants, circulate collaterals on the do's and do'nts weeks before and on the day of the elections, and aid in the decision making of the youth to pick the best choice from the variety of contenders.

We envision a country with fair and just government built with strong foundation from the elected officials who are education champions and stresses importance on the provision of education for the youth.
