IMPORTANT ANNOUNCEMENT: Please read CAREFULLY!

The Schedule for extended LMPC Applications will be open for Caraga Grantees on FEBRUARY 14-18, 2022. Please be reminded of the following:
-Priority for the LMPC Portal access is those grantees who have NOT started or finished their applications yet.
-If you have finished your application, PLEASE REFRAIN from logging in to the portal to minimize the possibility of the portal crashing due to website traffic.
-If you finished your application BUT have concerns about it or want to update your details, you MUST contact your Focal person first BEFORE logging in to know your status. If your application is EXPORTED you can no longer log in.
-If this is your first time logging in to the portal but your credentials are not recognized, please CONTACT your Focal Person to double check if they gave you the correct username and password. If the problem persists please bring it up in the group so that we can contact IT support.
-REFRAIN from trying to log in again and again within minutes because this may lead to your account being LOCKED.

Please also read FULLY the caption of UniFAST below for step-by-step assistance in making sure your application process is as smooth as possible. Thank you for your cooperation, grantees! #LMPC

Kwento ng pag-asa mula sa TES Grantee:

"A mother, a wife , an employee and a student." All of us have different dreams that we really want to pursue. I got pregnant when I was just 1st year college and 17 years old. Noong time na yon ay gumuho mundo ko pero alam mong it's all your fault pero hindi parin ako nawalan ng pag-asa. I started working at Robinson's department store in 2018 where it's my way to pay the enrollment fee in San Agustin Institute of Technology and 2019, I enrolled Bachelor of Science in Business Administration- Major in Financial Management. That year, I became TES scholar. I know it's hard because I need to go to work and go to school at the same time.

Pinagsabay ko na yong lahat habang nakasuot ako ng school uniform nasa ilalim narin yong stockings at saya pang trabaho. Pagkatapos ng klase takbuhan papuntang trabaho. by God's grace I managed them well.

San Agustin Institute of Technology

The Journey to a blind future
Growing up in a indigent family is hard, however it doesn't stops me for achieving what I deserve. Poverty never becomes my hindrance at all in pursuing the river of challenges. 
"Life is what you make it" a quotation that embarks in my mind that every problem has it means in solving, we only have to determine, identify or highlight the cause to derive to the best answer that we seek. Applying scientific knowledge to combat our shortcomings is the most effective way to uplift situations to our side. "HINDI MADALI ANG MAMUHAY SA HIRAP, BAGKOS MAS MAHIRAP MABUHAY KUNG WALA KA NI ISANG PANGARAP" poverty becomes my only motivation to push myself from day to day. I fought for my education and I never took for granted any opportunity that knocked on my doorstep. I was a part of the experimental batch of the K-12 program of the Department of Education year 2013-2015, after my graduation I worked to crawled for my tertiary education, it was indeed very arduous in pushing from day to day. Looking back to my parents situation pushes me harder to strive better to be the best. I never dreamed of anything except to uplift my family from poverty. 
I thank CHED-TES for granting me the opportunity that bridged my dreams to reality. A reality that will uplift the life not only of my family but also the people that needs hand to elevate their life to success.
and a special thanks also to our scholarship coordinator ma'am Babie Jaromay DE Guia for all the effort that she rendered during our academic year in our college journey. 
Maraming salamat po!

Kwento ng pag-asa mula sa TES Grantee:

Alang sa kasayuran sa tanan kabahin sa akong kinabuhi usa kami ka kabos ug walay igong kapasidad ang ginikanan sa paghatod sa kaugmaon sa anak nga mao ang pag edukar, isip osa ka anak nga adunay dakong pangandoy sa kinabuhi nga makabot ang maayong kaugmaon nga mao ang pag lampos sa pag skwela. That time wala pa si TES nag pakita ug akong gi tikang ang akong tiil sa pag bagtas sa mapait nga dalan sa akong kinabuhi aron lang ako maka skwela ug mapadayon ang pag tungha sa kolihiyo. Tuod man grasya sa Ginoo nalampos nko ang 1st year college without T.E.S. I thought kaya nko mapadayon ang akong pag tungha kung ako lang, pero dili d i labi na lack of financial sources. Salamat UNIFAST TES ng dahil sayo nakamit ko ang aking pangarap at sa ngayon graduate na po ako.

- Renelyn Cainglet Montoya, Christ the King College de Maranding, Inc.

Zonal Public Orientation on CMO No. 39, Series of 2021, and CMO No. 40, Series of 2021 (VISMIN)

The Commission on Higher Education through the Office of Programs and Standards Development, in coordination with CHED Regional Office IX, conducted the Zonal Public Orientation on CMO No. 39, series 2021, entitled "Policies, Standards and Guidelines on the Implementation of Tertiary Physical Education: Physical Activity Towards Health and Fitness (PATHFIT) Courses" and Walkthrough Orientation on CMO No. 40, series 2021, entitled "Guidelines on the Implementation of Flexible Learning for Tertiary Physical Education: Physical Activity Towards Health and Fitness (PATHFIT) Courses" for VISMIN Zone via Hybrid mode, with a face-to-face venue held in Zamboanga City.

The said public orientation aimed at providing a common understanding and appreciation of the design and delivery of PATHFit courses which is imperative in the development of a coherent and cohesive curriculum across all levels and all program offerings of the Higher Education Institutions (HEIs). The implementation of the CMOs is in consonance with the new General Education Curriculum (GEC) as outlined in CMO No. 20, series 2013, the implementation of Flexible Learning as provided in CMO No. 4, series 2020, and in light of the outcomes-based education as well as the constitutional mandate that the state shall promote physical education to foster self-discipline teamwork, and excellence for the development of a healthy and alert citizenry.

The success of the activity was evident through the presence and active involvement of the members of the Technical Committee for Physical Education, Sports, and Wellness Management (TCPESWM), and our partner HEIs in the implementation of the CMOs to achieve the desired learning outcomes of PATHFit courses through active and healthy living, advocacy, and action.

Press Release
30 June 2021
CHED warns public on individuals posing as UniFAST representatives to solicit money for TES program eligibility
The Commission on Higher Education (CHED) is warning higher education institutions (HEIs), students and their parents, against individuals and/or groups representing themselves as officials and personnel of the Unified Student Financial Assistance System for Tertiary Education (UniFAST).
UniFAST is an attached agency of CHED and the primary implementer of Free Higher Education (FHE) and the Tertiary Education Subsidy (TES) program under Republic Act 10931 or the Universal Access to Quality Tertiary Education law.
CHED recently received a formal complaint from a certain group of schools against individuals offering a deal with other institutions to facilitate their “UniFAST accreditation” in order to receive benefits from TES. 
The said individuals allegedly held a ceremonial awarding of UniFAST certificates of accreditation to other member schools using an unofficial UniFAST letterhead and logo without the consent or knowledge of the UniFAST Secretariat.
The scam alert comes as the new Academic Year 2021-2022 approaches and most students and their families are eager to seek applications for scholarships or any financial aid available just to support their college education during this time of the COVID-19 pandemic.
“These posers trying to coax other schools to be accredited in the TES program are not even HEIs but members of one of the secondary school group branches, so they have no business with CHED. Let us be wary and do a fact-check especially when there’s payment involved and a promise of guaranteed TES slots to its students,” said CHED and UniFAST Board Chairman Popoy De Vera. 
De Vera stressed that all transactions are done through the HEIs and CHED offices. There are no groups or organizations authorized by CHED to recruit or process papers of students.
UniFAST OIC-Executive Director Ryan Estevez is already investigating the matter and has already corresponded with the National Bureau of Investigation (NBI) in confirming the identities mentioned in the complaint and confirming that they are NOT in any way affiliated with CHED or UniFAST. 
“We ask our HEIs to help us disseminate the correct information about the TES program so that our students are always guided on the proper processes for TES inclusion,” added De Vera.
The TES is a grant-in aid program funded by the national government that follows a prioritization scheme in its selection of qualified TES grantees from public universities and colleges, and private HEIs with an existing memorandum of agreement with CHED and UniFAST to implement the TES program.
The call for TES application in AY 2021-2022 will soon be announced on the official websites and verified social media accounts of CHED and UniFAST. 
(SIGNED)
J. PROSPERO E. DE VERA III
Chairman
CHED and UniFAST Board

Press Release
13 November 2021
Medical, nursing students can now be vaccinators - CHED
Post-graduate/undergraduate interns, clinical clerks, and fourth-year medicine and nursing students can now become vaccinators and participate in the National COVID-19 Vaccine Deployment and Vaccination Program.
This is after the Commission on Higher Education (CHED) and the Department of Health (DOH) released Joint Memorandum Circular (JMC) No. 2021-003 entitled, “Interim Guidelines on the Voluntary Participation of Postgraduate/Undergraduate Interns, Clinical Clerks, and Fourth Year Nursing Students in the COVID-19 Vaccine Deployment and Vaccination Program.”
These students can volunteer as health screeners, vaccinators, and pre/post vaccination monitors under the supervision of licensed physicians and nurses.
The JMC provides guidance to participating higher education institutions (HEIs), hospitals with National Internship Program and all governance levels participating in the National COVID-19 Vaccine Deployment and Vaccination Program.
“The government is now fast tracking the vaccination roll-out as more COVID-19 vaccines arrive in the country. Yesterday and for the 2nd time, the country breached the 1 million daily target for vaccination. As we increase the number of vaccination sites and increase daily targets, these additional vaccinators and support staff are critical to achieve herd immunity in the next two months,” said CHED Chairman Popoy De Vera.
CHED has been pushing for school based vaccination in all big private and public HEIs since October. So far, 61 HEIs are now functioning as vaccination centers all over the country.
“While more than 1 million college students have already been vaccinated, this is only about 30% of the target number. We need to rapidly vaccinate more students,” De Vera added.
The post-graduate/undergraduate interns, clinical clerks and fourth year nursing students who will volunteer will be trained and supervised by health professionals. Their volunteer work and completed number of hours will be credited in their internship and will be certified by the head of the vaccination team in the particular vaccination site where they rendered their services.
On its part, CHED will disseminate the policy to and orient CHED Regional Offices, HEIs, and hospitals with National Internship Programs, monitor the implementation of the policy, and provide data to DOH as to the number of HEIs/hospitals participating and volunteers deployed.
The voluntary participation of these students in vaccination sites will be implemented regardless of the area’s risk classification as categorized by the Inter-Agency Task Force for Emerging Infectious Diseases (IATF-EID).
All CHED regional offices have been instructed to work with HEIs that have medicine and nursing programs to produce an inventory of student-volunteer vaccinators and work with the DOH and local governments to assign these student volunteers to the various vaccination sites.
For more information, please visit: https://bit.ly/CHED-DOH-JMC3s2021.
(SIGNED)
J. PROSPERO E. DE VERA III, DPA
Chairman
Commission on Higher Education

Full story:

CHED-CAR UniFAST Unit joins the nation in its observance of the 2022 18-Day Campaign to End Violence Against Women.

Aligning the Philippine Campaign with UNiTE by 2030 and sustaining the traction gained from the 2016 to 2021 theme, “VAW-free Community Starts with Me,” the upcoming Campaign will focus on the new recurring banner “UNiTEd for a VAW-free Philippines.” This theme aims to highlight the powerful impact of combining individual efforts towards a collaborative and united thrust towards a VAW-free Philippines.

Together, let us end VAW!

You can also join this campaign via social media, PINASkolars, by using the hashtag #VAWfreePH and by using the Facebook Profile Frame. For more details, visit https://pcw.gov.ph/2022-18-day-campaign-to-end-violence-against-women/.
In photos: CHED Chairman J. Prospero E. De Vera III visits the Caraga Region for the first time - at Siargao Island Institute of Technology.

Press Release
28 September 2021

Expansion of limited face-to-face classes to other degree programs approved by PRRD - CHED

President Rodrigo Roa Duterte has approved the Commission on Higher Education's (CHED) request for the expansion of limited face-to-face classes to other degree programs that require hands-on experience in higher education institutions (HEIs) under Modified General Community Quarantine (MGCQ).

The urgent need for hands-on experience and the safety of students taking up medicine and allied health courses, who were permitted by the national government to conduct limited face-to-face classes since January 2021, is the key for CHED to recommend on the expansion proposal.

CHED presented to IATF the evidence on the ground that would show that the mechanisms that have been put in place, retrofitting of facilities by HEIs, observance of health protocols, putting up of Crisis Management Committees, coordination with LGUs concerned, etc., were effective in ensuring the achievement of the competencies of students/graduates without compromising their safety.

Executive Secretary Salvador Medialdea on September 21, 2021 issued the authority for face to face activities in the following areas:
Engineering and Technology programs
Hospitality/ Hotel and Restaurant Management
Tourism/ Travel Management
Marine Engineering
Marine Transportation

"The Commission thanks President Rodrigo Roa Duterte for the approval of limited face-to-face classes for the said programs in order to contribute to the efforts to boost the economic recovery of the country, as this will directly affect human resource development," said CHED Chairman Popoy De Vera.

"Based on the data we gathered on the ground, there is a small percentage of students and faculty members who were affected by COVID-19. I'm convinced that it is safe to hold face-to-face classes and it can be expanded to cover other degree programs," De Vera added.

Of the close to 2,000 universities and colleges, about almost half have already opened the school year. Others are planning to start classes in October or November.

"I have been in constant discussion with NTF Chief Implementor Carlito G. Galvez and we are now aggressively pushing for the vaccination of all faculty, staff and students in HEIs to add another layer of protection to our face-to-face classes. Some of our HEIs have completed the vaccination of their employees and students. We aim to do it for other HEIs as more vaccines arrive," De Vera said.

"We assure our students, parents and faculty that holding in-person classes is safe. Our guidelines are strict," he added.

HEIs intending to have limited face-to-face classes as part of their flexible learning policy may now apply for authority with CHED Regional Offices concerned.

(SIGNED)
J. PROSPERO E. DE VERA III, DPA
Chairman
Commission on Higher Education

FEATURE STORY: Did you know that in the Cordillera Administrative Region, more females are benefiting from the Tertiary Education Subsidy program than males?

In one of his speeches, President Rodrigo Roa Duterte said that"Education is the single most important legacy that we can bestow upon our youth." He further emphasized the importance of education that it opens doors for countless opportunities that will lead to their further empowerment, greater success and the realization of their individual aspirations. The administration's commitment to providing quality and affordable education for all has been manifested by the enactment of the Republic Act No. 10931 or the Universal Access to Quality Tertiary Education Act of 2017.

RA 10931 aims to provide all Filipinos with equal and accessible opportunities to quality tertiary education in both the private and public educational institutions, especially the poor.

One amongst the major components of RA 10931 is the Tertiary Education Subsidy program or TES which aims to support the cost of tertiary education of Filipino students who enrol in their first undergraduate-post-secondary program in state universities and colleges (SUCs), local universities and colleges (LUCs), private higher education institutions (HEIs) and technical-vocational institutions (TVIs).

For the first semester of the academic year 2021-2022, the subsidy benefited 4,177 beneficiaries in the Cordillera Administrative Region of which 2,867 or 68.64% are women. This number of female beneficiaries parallels with the statistics of enrolled female students in the region. In the region, 59.87% are female students whereas 40.13% are male.

The greater number of female students and beneficiaries in the Region signifies the greater desire and passion of women in pursuing higher education. With this year's theme for Women's Month Celebration"We Make Change Work for Women," we can therefore say that RA 10931 truly made change work for women in education for it made access to quality education affordable and universal to all especially the women.

Nakalatag na ang hapag nang muli na namang buksan ni Mallanaga ang tarangkahan ng aklat ng "Kama Sutra".
Muli na namang naihain ang hapunan ng papaimbabáw na init ng dalawang magkikiskisang buntala.
Mula sa mangasul-ngasul na kulay, sa dilawang bahagi, hanggang sa pinagsanib-p'wersang dalandan at pula.
Muling tunghayan ang ibang bers'yon ng indayog mula sa nagniningas na senaryo nina Parvati at Shiva.
Kasabay ng saliw ng musika, ang ritmo ng pulso ang nagtakda ng oras sa mga katawang duyan ay sariling mga lansa.
Naitakda na ang kamang kauláyaw ay dayukdok na lamáng dulot ng hipnotismo; ang nakararahuyong salamangka.
Naitakda rin ang pagpatay sa aandap-andap na gasera upang ang apat na sulok na may tulis at kurba'y lubusang madama.
Handa nang marating ang rurok ng ibang uri ng kalangitang mga bala'y nagliliyab na lagkit ng pulburá.
Magkasámang nagtampisaw sa nag-aalab na likido ang pinagtambal na baterya at pantablay na sabik sa pagkadarang.
Nakapapaso ang limang uri ng pandamang pasirkulong pumaimbulog sa iba't-ibang dimens'yon ng kalagkitan.
Ang kaligayahang seksuwal ng isang pares na kumagat sa bitag na pumailanlang sa alapaap ng kaluwalhatian.
Ang nilasap na sarap ng putaheng sagana sa panggatong; sa pagpapanatili ng init ng bawat sandaling kinahumalingan.
Maging sa pagkagumon sa pagkamaralitang 'di man lang naranasan ang "dharma" at "artha"; ang taglay nitong yaman at kinang.
Ang pagdiin at pag-impit na dumura ng katas na 'di inisip ang kumunoy nang nag-aabang na dagtum na karimlan.
Nilamukos ng magkaibang kasarian ang simula ng layunin sa manuskritong ipinahayag ni Indra at walang paghunos-diling sinilaban.
Kaya sa kama ng panandaliang sarap na 'di pinag-isipan, magagampanan nga ba ang responsibilidad pagkatapos ng siyam na buwan?
___________________________________________
☝️Paalala po: Ang mga talinghaga't tayutay ko po sa akdang nasa itaas po ay naglalaman po ng mga maseselang bahagi. Hangad ko lamang po ang malawak niyo pong pang-unawa. Maraming salamat po.🙏✍️
🦸Ang mga barang ginamit ko po sa tula ay hango sa sinaunang aklat ng pag-ibig mula sa Indiya na isinulat ni Mallanaga Vatsyayana na pinamagatang, "Kama Sutra" at  binigyan ko lamang po ng katingkaran ang kulay gamit ang bers'yong Pinoy. Ang "kāma" ay nangangahulugang, "kaligayang sensuwal o seksuwal" at ang "sūtra" nama'y nangangahulugang, "sinulid o guhit" sa metaporikal na pamamaraan. Samantalang  ang "artha" nama'y patungkol sa "kabutihan" at ang "dharma" ay patungkol naman sa kayamanan (sa pangkalahatan o kabuuan ng konsepto). Si Indra Sinha ang tumalakay sa unang parte ng aklat tungkol sa mga layunin ng sinaunang buhay pag-ibig. Sina Parvati at Shiva ay ang mag-asawang diyos-diyosan ng mga taga-Indiya.
🦸Malayang Berso ng Panulaan
🦸Apat na Saknong na may Tig-aapat na Taludtod
🦸Eskema ng Pagririma, "AAAA-AAAA-BBBB-BBBB"

Good day po! Isa po ako sa mga 𝗧𝘂𝗹𝗼𝗻𝗴 𝗗𝘂𝗻𝗼𝗻𝗴 𝗣𝗿𝗼𝗴𝗿𝗮𝗺 (𝗧𝗗𝗣) 𝗯𝗲𝗻𝗲𝗳𝗶𝗰𝗶𝗮𝗿𝘆. I got my grant from our 𝗰𝗼𝗻𝗴𝗿𝗲𝘀𝘀𝗺𝗮𝗻’𝘀 𝗼𝗳𝗳𝗶𝗰𝗲 (𝗠𝗮𝗻𝗱𝗮𝗹𝘂𝘆𝗼𝗻𝗴 𝗖𝗶𝘁𝘆) and 𝗜❜𝘃𝗲 𝗯𝗲𝗲𝗻 𝗮 𝗯𝗲𝗻𝗲𝗳𝗶𝗰𝗶𝗮𝗿𝘆 𝘀𝗶𝗻𝗰𝗲 𝗦𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹 𝗬𝗲𝗮𝗿 𝟮𝟬𝟭𝟴-𝟮𝟬𝟭𝟵. Unlike some of the scholars who receive their stipend through their Landbank cards, I receive mine through 𝒄𝒉𝒆𝒒𝒖𝒆 kahit po nagpa-open ako ng account as advised of the coordinators in the congressman’s office. 𝗗𝗮𝗹𝗮𝘄𝗮𝗻𝗴 (𝟮) 𝗯𝗲𝘀𝗲𝘀 𝗽𝗮 𝗹𝗮𝗻𝗴 po ako nakakatanggap ng 𝒄𝒉𝒆𝒒𝒖𝒆 and that’s for 𝗦𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹 𝗬𝗲𝗮𝗿 𝟮𝟬𝟭𝟴-𝟮𝟬𝟭𝟵. Due to undefined delays and the pandemic wala na po akong nakuhang stipend kahit na maayos ang grades ko at nagpapasa ako ng requirements for renewal on time.
𝗜𝗻 𝗺𝘆 𝗼𝗽𝗶𝗻𝗶𝗼𝗻, 𝗺𝗮𝘀 𝗹𝗮𝗹𝗼𝗻𝗴 𝗴𝘂𝗺𝘂𝗹𝗼 𝗮𝘁 𝗻𝗮-𝗱𝗲𝗹𝗮𝘆 ang pag-release ng allowance ko 𝘀𝗶𝗺𝘂𝗹𝗮 𝗻𝗼𝗼𝗻𝗴 𝗶𝗻𝗶𝗹𝗶𝗽𝗮𝘁 𝘀𝗮 𝗥𝗶𝘇𝗮𝗹 𝗧𝗲𝗰𝗵𝗻𝗼𝗹𝗼𝗴𝗶𝗰𝗮𝗹 𝗨𝗻𝗶𝘃𝗲𝗿𝘀𝗶𝘁𝘆 (𝗥𝗧𝗨-𝗕𝗼𝗻𝗶) 𝗮𝗻𝗴 𝗺𝗴𝗮 𝗧𝗗𝗣 𝗿𝗲𝗻𝗲𝘄𝗮𝗹. In my case, 𝗻𝗮𝗴-𝗿𝗲𝗻𝗲𝘄 𝗮𝗸𝗼 𝘀𝗮 𝗢𝗳𝗳𝗶𝗰𝗲 𝗼𝗳 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗖𝗼𝗻𝗴𝗿𝗲𝘀𝘀𝗺𝗮𝗻 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗦𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹 𝗬𝗲𝗮𝗿 𝟮𝟬𝟭𝟵-𝟮𝟬𝟮𝟬 𝗮𝘁 𝘆𝘂𝗻𝗴 𝗺𝗴𝗮 𝗸𝗮𝘀𝗮𝗯𝗮𝘆𝗮𝗻 𝗸𝗼𝗻𝗴 𝗻𝗮𝗴-𝗿𝗲𝗻𝗲𝘄 𝗮𝘆 𝗻𝗮𝗸𝗮𝗸𝘂𝗵𝗮 𝗻𝗮 𝗻𝗴 𝗰𝗵𝗲𝗾𝘂𝗲 𝗻𝗶𝗹𝗮 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗦𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹 𝗬𝗲𝗮𝗿 𝟮𝟬𝟭𝟵-𝟮𝟬𝟮𝟬 𝗙𝗶𝗿𝘀𝘁 𝗦𝗲𝗺𝗲𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗿 𝗮𝘁 𝗶𝘆𝗼𝗻𝗴 𝗮𝗸𝗶𝗻 𝗮𝘆 𝗻𝗮-𝗱𝗲𝗹𝗮𝘆 𝗱𝗮𝗵𝗶𝗹 𝗶𝘀𝗶𝗻𝗮𝗯𝗮𝘆 ❞𝘆𝗮𝘁𝗮❞ 𝘀𝗮 𝗥𝗧𝗨 𝗧𝗗𝗣 𝗯𝗲𝗻𝗲𝗳𝗶𝗰𝗶𝗮𝗿𝗶𝗲𝘀. Kung susumahin 𝗔𝗣𝗔𝗧 𝗡𝗔 𝗦𝗘𝗠𝗘𝗦𝗧𝗘𝗥𝗦 𝗻𝗮 𝗽𝗼 𝗻𝗴 𝗮𝗹𝗹𝗼𝘄𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗲 𝗮𝗻𝗴 𝗵𝗶𝗻𝗱𝗶 𝗸𝗼 𝗽𝗮 𝗻𝗮𝘁𝗮𝘁𝗮𝗻𝗴𝗴𝗮𝗽, 𝘀𝗶𝗺𝘂𝗹𝗮 𝗦𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹 𝗬𝗲𝗮𝗿 𝟮𝟬𝟭𝟵-𝟮𝟬𝟮𝟬 𝗵𝗮𝗻𝗴𝗴𝗮𝗻𝗴 𝗦𝗰𝗵𝗼𝗼𝗹 𝗬𝗲𝗮𝗿 𝟮𝟬𝟮𝟬-𝟮𝟬𝟮𝟭, malaking bagay po kung makukuha ko (namin) ang allowance dahil marami po kaming nangangailangan nito kaya nga po kami nag-apply for scholarship.
Concern and Questions:
Nagkaroon po ng group chat and TDP Beneficiaries ng RTU, doon po mayroong mga nagsabi na marami ang sumubok na makipag-communicate sa CHED-NCR though email at ang palaging sinasabi ay naibigay na sa RTU ang fund para sa School Year 2019-2020, at kapag RTU naman ang tinanong ang isasagot ay wala pa sa kanila.
Maaari po bang huwag na isabay ang aking grant sa RTU dahil nakuha ko naman po ang grant ko sa office ng congressman namin? Noong sa congressman po kasi ako nagre-renew isang semester lang po ang nagiging delay para matanggap ko ang allowance, ngayon po ay dalawang taon na ang delay.
Kung pwede din po sana na maipaliwanag sa scholars (ng RTU) kung bakit inilipat sa RTU (SUCs) ang renewal process nila. Hihingi na din po sana ako ng maayos na explanation ng mga dahilan sa pagkakaroon ng delay sa allowance dahil iyon po ang hindi namin natanggap simula’t sapul.
May paraan po ba para mailipat ang grant from TDP to TES? Napansin ko po kasi na bukod sa mas mataas ang nakukuha nilang stipend, mas mabilis din ang aksyon at response kapag TES ang nagtatanong at may concern. Sila din po ang laging laman ng posts ng CHED, UniFAST at ni Sir Popoy.
Sana po ay mapansin at matugunan itong post na ito. Salamat po at lagi’t lagi kayong mag-iingat.

550 𝐬𝐭𝐮𝐝𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐬 𝐫𝐞𝐜𝐞𝐢𝐯𝐞 𝐂𝐇𝐄𝐃'𝐬 𝐓𝐞𝐫𝐭𝐢𝐚𝐫𝐲 𝐄𝐝𝐮𝐜𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧 𝐒𝐮𝐛𝐬𝐢𝐝𝐲 𝐟𝐨𝐫 𝐀𝐘 2021-2022 2𝐧𝐝 𝐒𝐞𝐦𝐞𝐬𝐭𝐞𝐫
A total of 550 students of Siargao Island Institute of Technology received their Tertiary Education Subsidy for the 2nd semester, academic year 2021-2022 from December 6-7, 2022 at the SIIT grounds. 
The distribution of the said subsidy started with a message from Mr. Aldous Bou, reminding the grantees and their parents that the subsidy is intended to aid the education of the students in terms of their financial needs. 
School president, Atty. Lalo Matugas , who personally handed the subsidy to the parent/guardian of the grantees expressed his gratitude to the Commission on Higher Education. He also extended his appreciation to the founder and chair emeritus, Dr. Sol Forcadilla Matugas  who is instrumental in the realization of this program and to Cong Bingo Matugas  who was one of the representatives who approved this government grant-aid program.   
"Gikan pa sa una, amo na gajud pangandoy ni Mayor Sol na an tanan kabatan-onan sa isla makatapos nan kolehiyo. Isa, duha o kun mahimo tanan anak sa isa ka pamilya. Kay lagi gusto namo na tanan estudyante makakat-on nan de kalidad na edukasyon maski ini ra ‘ta sa isla, “ Pres. Matugas stated.
The aforementioned number of students is just the first and second tranche. Another wave of distribution is expected to happen next week to complete the 1,079 number of TES grantees.

Dagdag biyaya para sa TDP cuties ng Silangang Visayas! 🙏
In the collaboration of UniFAST and CHED Regional Office VIII, they released an additional ₱17.2 million Tulong-Dunong funds to 31 public higher education institutions in the region. This release covers the 1st semester benefits of 2,290 continuing grantees for the Academic Year 2020-2021.

: "Through the Tertiary Education Subsidy program of CHED and UniFAST, i see no reason why any student will not be able to finish his or her college degree." 

-Rep. Ma. Theresa V. Collantes
3rd District, Batangas
Deputy Majority Floor Leader,â€¦

Mabuhay ang mga Guro sa buong Mundo! 
Sa ngalan ng Komisyon sa Mas Mataas na Edukasyon o CHED at mula sa isang guro ng Pamantasan ng Pilipinas, ako ay bumabati sa inyong lahat ng isang “Maligayang Araw ng mga Guro sa Mundo.” 
Tulad ng lahat ng mga guro sa buong mundo, mahalaga at personal ang pagdiriwang na ito para sa akin. Sa mga hindi po nakakaalam, ang nanay ko po ay isang guro na nakapagtapos sa Philippine Normal University. Siya ay nagturo ng biology sa iba’t ibang eskwelahan at nagretiro bilang Assistant Principal at Ramon Magsaysay Manila. Siya po ang aking idolo, ang aking role model noong ako ay lumalaki. Siya ang isang malaking dahilan kung bakit ako ay naging guro din.
Actually, my whole life has also been spent in teaching since I graduated at 19 years old at the University of the Philippines. I started teaching history and political science at Trinity College and went on to teach in UP, DLSU, and other universities for more than four decades now. Hanggang ngayon po ay propesor ako sa UP NCPAG. 
So I have lived and I know the feeling of changing people's lives through education. This day is therefore not only a recognition of the importance of teachers but an affirmation, for all of us, that we chose the correct path, the correct profession, because we want to make a difference in the lives of people.
We often hear the saying that “the teacher is the heart of the educational system”. In higher education we say, professors are the soul of the university, and without professors there are no universities. 
But teachers don’t only produce engineers, doctors, or lawyers, they themselves are movers and shakers of history.
Let me give you some examples. Former US President Barack Obama was America’s teacher-in-chief for eight years. He was a professor of law at the University of Chicago from 1992 until his 2004 election to the U.S. Senate.
For the more senior among us, Woodrow Wilson, the 28th President of the US, was the President of Princeton University before becoming the US President that presided over the difficulties brought about by World War 1. He championed the creation of the League of Nations which was the precursor of the United Nations to foster global cooperation and peace.
The current prime minister of Canada, Justin Trudeau, finished a bachelor’s degree in education and literature. Trudeau taught elementary math as well as high school French, humanities and drama for three years at a private school, and as a substitute teacher at a public school. 
He said he became a teacher to have “a positive influence on the world,” and that goal was accomplished when he selected Canada’s first cabinet with an equal number of men and women to show the diversity of the Canadian nation.
Napakaswerte ko po dahil ang aking mga naging boss sa Senado ay mga teacher. Si Senator Teroy Laurel ay Presidente ng Lyceum University nung siya ay nahalal na senador. Si Senator Nene Pimentel ay naging pinaka batang dekano ng Xavier Law School, naging Senate President, at may akda ng bibliya ng mga pamahalaang lokal, ang Local Government Code. 
Si Senator Leticia Ramos Shahani ay nagturo sa UP, naging ambassador sa iba’t ibang bansa, UN Assistant Secretary General ng  the UN, at nakilala bilang kampeon ng karapatang pang kababaihan. Lahat sila matalino, magaling, walang bahid ng korupsyon. Lahat sila teacher. 
So the saying is indeed true. Those who teach can do just about anything, and excel in many arenas. Whatever challenge is brought to us, we persevere, we succeed. Like now, the challenges brought about by the COVID-19 pandemic.
Ang tema ng selebrasyon ng World Teachers’ Day ngayong taon ay “Teachers at the heart of education recovery.” Tama at nasasang-ayon ito sa panahon ng pandemya. 
Ang ating mga minamahal na Gurong Filipino, kayo ay katuwang sa hamon at kasama sa pagbangon.
Ang sektor ng edukasyon ay patuloy na binabago ng pandemya. Bagamat marami ang negatibong nagmula sa pandemya, oportunidad din ito upang baguhin at pagbutihin natin ang paraan ng pagtuturo sa kasalukuyang sitwasyon.
Alam ko po na hindi naging madali ang mga pagbabagong ginagawa ng ating mga guro upang makatugon sa mga hamon ng COVID-19. Sa aking pag ikot sa buong Pilipinas nitong nakaraang mga buwan, nakausap ko ang maraming mga guro at estudyante at narinig ko ang mga kwento ng mahinang internet connection, kakulangan ng mga gadyet, magastos na load, hirap sa pagbuo ng bagong syllabus at teaching materials, at ang takot na mahawaan ng COVID19 virus.  
Kasama ninyo ang CHED sa paghahanap ng mga solusyon sa mga suliraning hinaharap ng mga guro at sa  patuloy na paghahanap ng mga paraan upang lahat tayo ay  makaka sabay sa mga pagbabago sa larangan ng pagtuturo.
Patuloy na nagsasagawa ng pagsasanay para sa mga guro ang mga sangay ng Komisyon sa iba’t ibang rehiyon dahil naniniwala kami na kayo ay dapat maging bihasa sa mga bago at napapanahong paraan ng pagtuturo gamit ang flexible learning sa inyong mga pamantasan. 
Layunin ng CHED na ang mga guro ng mas mataas na edukasyon ay nananatiling nakakasunod sa panahon ng digital technology. Kalakip na dito ang mga makabago at usong pamamaraan ng technology-based teaching and learning methodologies na ginagamit hindi lamang sa Pilipinas pati na sa ibang bansa, at iba pang mga prosesong maituturing na mabisa ngayong may pandemya.
Higit sa lahat, sa panahong laganap pa rin ang COVID-19, sinisiguro ng CHED ang kaligtasan at kalusugan ng mga guro habang unti unti nating binubuksan ang ating mga pamantasan.
Noong Enero, binuksan na natin ang limited face to face classes sa medisina at allied health sciences.
Noong Abril, ipinaglaban natin sa IATF ang pagtaas ng klasipikasyon ng mga guro bilang essential workers kaya’t naiangat ang priority level mula B1 at ginawang A4, at napabilis ang pagbabakuna sa mga guro.
At nitong nakaraan na buwan, pinayagan nang mag limited face to face sa engineering and technology programs, hotel and restaurant management, hospitality management,  at maritime programs.
Unti unti, sa ating sama samang pagtutulungan, sa pamamagitan ng Bayanihan, nagpapatuloy and pagbabalik ng ligtas at mayabong na edukasyon dahil sa mga teacher, para sa mga teacher, at para sa lahat. 
Happy World Teachers’ Day! Maraming Salamat po!
 # #
- Mensahe ni CHED Chairman Popoy De Vera ngayong Teachers' Day

ALAM MO BA?

Ang Listahanan ay hindi isang programa para sa mahihirap. Ito ay listahan lamang at nagiging batayan sa pagtukoy kung sino at nasaan ang mga mahihirap sa bansa.

Mandato nitong ibahagi sa National Government Agencies (NGAs), Local Government Units (LGUs), at iba pang organisasyon upang maging basehan nila ng pagpili ng karapat-dapat na maging benepisyaryo ng social protection programs and services.

Narito ang ilang karagdagang impormasyon tungkol sa Listahanan project.
